analyzed: rtsa'i khong stong du nam mkha'i kha dog dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: de yang rab 'jig byed pa ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: And that is the great destroyer, which is the destroyer.

analyzed: shar phyogs su ni lha sbyin ma'i rtsa ru 'khor lo chen po ni sha chen te /
translated: In the east, in the channel of Devadatta, the great wheel is human flesh.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba ni don yod grub pa'i 'od zer te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba ni don yod grub pa'i 'od zer te /

analyzed: de rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa ni de'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //

original: lho phyogs su ni lho'i rtsa ru rus sbal ma la rin chen chen po'i khrag ste /
analyzed: lho phyogs su ni lho'i rtsa ru rus sbal ma la rin chen chen po'i khrag ste /
translated: In the south, in the southern nāḍī, the tortoise is the blood of the great jewel.

analyzed: 'od zer mang po ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi 'od zer rnams kyis 'khrigs pa ni de'i ngo bor bsgom par @72b bya'o ;

original: / de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs su ni nor rgyal ma'i rtsal /
analyzed: / de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs su ni nor rgyal ma'i rtsal /
translated: In the same way, in the west, in the nāḍī of Vasudharā,

original: padma chen po ni bshang pa chen po ste /
analyzed: padma chen po ni bshang pa chen po ste /

original: padma r'a ga ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: padma r'a ga ni rnam par snang mdzad de /

original: de'i kha dog dang 'dra ba ni de'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i kha dog dang 'dra ba ni de'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think of the color of that as the nature of that.

analyzed: de bzhin du byang phyogs su ni rtsa g-yon pa la zla ba ma la rnam par rtog pa gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in the north, in the left nāḍī, the moon is the conceptual thought of the mind.

original: ral gri chen po ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: ral gri chen po ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The great sword is the relative bodhicitta.

original: 'od zer 'bar ba ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'od zer 'bar ba ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi snang ba ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyis 'khrigs pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the mass of those as having the nature of that.

analyzed: de bzhin du shar gyi grva ni dgongs pa'i bshad pas mig g-yon pa la spyan ni de nyid kyi dri ma ste /
translated: Similarly, in the northeast corner, the eye in the left eye is the stain of that [Amitābha].

original: dbus na sprin dang 'dra ba ni 'phags pa rdo rje ro langs ma'i ngo bo nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus na sprin dang 'dra ba ni 'phags pa rdo rje ro langs ma'i ngo bo nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The cloud-like one in the middle should be meditated on as having the nature of Ārya Vajravetālī.

original: mig g-yas pa la rdo rje ni mig g-yas pa'i rgyu ba m'a ma k'i'i rigs ni 'phags ma gzhan gyis mi thub ma las 'byung ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mig g-yas pa la rdo rje ni mig g-yas pa'i rgyu ba m'a ma k'i'i rigs ni 'phags ma gzhan gyis mi thub ma las 'byung ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: The vajra in the right eye is the family of the movement of the right eye, which arises from Ārya Aparājitā. One should think of it as having the nature of that.

original: nub phyogs su zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du rna ba g-yon pa la padma ni de nyid kyi dri ma ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs su zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du rna ba g-yon pa la padma ni de nyid kyi dri ma ste /
translated: In the west, as before, the lotus in the left ear is the stain of that [Amitābha].

original: kha phye ba sdong bur bcas pa ni 'phags ma khro gnyer ma'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kha phye ba sdong bur bcas pa ni 'phags ma khro gnyer ma'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The open one with a stem should be meditated on as having the nature of Ārya Bhṛkuṭī.

original: byang phyogs ni rna ba g-yas pa autpala ni de nyid kyi dri ma ste /
analyzed: byang phyogs ni rna ba g-yas pa autpala ni de nyid kyi dri ma ste /
translated: The north is the right ear, and the utpala is its stain.

original: mthing ga'i sprin dang 'dra ba ni 'phags ma ral pa gcig ma'i ngo bo nyid bsam par bya'o //🔽shar phyogs ni rdo rje ste der rdo rjes 'dzin ma ste de'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //

translated: The blue cloud is to be contemplated as the essence of Noble Ekajaṭī.🔽The east is the vajra, and there Vajradhara is to be contemplated as the essence of its stain.

original: lho phyogs kyi sgo ni lte ba ste de la rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma ni lte ba'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sgo ni lte ba ste de la rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma ni lte ba'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
translated: The southern gate is the navel, and there Vajrapaśī is to be contemplated as the essence of its stain.

original: nub phyogs kyi sgo ni bshad sgo ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi sgo ni bshad sgo ste /
translated: The western gate is the anus,

original: de la rdo rje ska rags ma ni de'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rdo rje ska rags ma ni de'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam bar bya'o //
translated: and there Vajranāla is to be contemplated as the essence of its stain.

original: byang phyogs kyi sgo ni rgyab ste de la rin chen sgrol ma ni de'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi sgo ni rgyab ste de la rin chen sgrol ma ni de'i dri ma'i ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
translated: The northern gate is the back, and there Ratnatārā is to be contemplated as the essence of its stain.

original: des ni 'di bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: thob pa la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i btsun mo rnams kyi rang bzhin du dri ma rnams ni sku'i dkyil 'khor la bsgom par bya'o //

translated: The nature of the consorts such as Acala, etc., indicated by the words “attainment,” etc., should be meditated upon in the body mandala.

analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / sems kyi ngo bo sku'i dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor pas bsam par bya ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //

original: yongs su gsal bar shes byas nas //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar shes byas nas //
translated: Having understood it to be completely clear,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: bud med rab tu mdangs bzang ba //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: gzugs dang mdangs la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pas bzang ba ste gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mdangs la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pas bzang ba ste gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: She is excellent, that is, clear, by the perfection of her form, complexion, and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyi mdzes pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mdzes pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the natural beauty,

original: brtags pa'i mdzes pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: brtags pa'i mdzes pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: the imagined beauty should be taught.

original: dri dang me tog ni /
analyzed: dri dang me tog ni /
translated: The perfume and the flower

original: gur gum dang sihla ka dar tsam pa ka la sogs pas ni brgyan cing de'i dbus su 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: gur gum dang sihla ka dar tsam pa ka la sogs pas ni brgyan cing de'i dbus su 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
translated: Adorned with saffron, musk, camphor, and so forth, in the center of that, in the center of the previously explained mandala.

original: mnyes par bya ba ni gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bya ba ni gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should please her with secret worship.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: sangs rgyas zhi ba'i gnas spros pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhi ba'i gnas spros pas //
translated: By the emanation of the abode of the Buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i aom la sogs pa'i sa bon lnga po spyi bo dang / lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang / rked pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas byin gyis brlabs nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i aom la sogs pa'i sa bon lnga po spyi bo dang / lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang / rked pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas byin gyis brlabs nas so //
translated: Having consecrated the five seed syllables of the Tathagatas, Om and so forth, on the head, throat, heart, navel, waist, and secret place,

original: shes rab can ni sngags dgod pa la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: shes rab can ni sngags dgod pa la mkhas pas so //
translated: the wise one, skilled in the arrangement of the mantras,

original: bud med de ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: bud med de ji lta bu zhen /
translated: what kind of woman?

original: m'a ma k'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i zhes pa ni /
translated: Mamaki,

original: m'a ma k'i ni rnam par rdzogs pa dang / yon tan ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni rnam par rdzogs pa dang / yon tan ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Mamaki is the perfection, and qualities are faith and so forth.

original: de nyid ska rags ni rgyan gang la yod pa de ni yod tan ska rags m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid ska rags ni rgyan gang la yod pa de ni yod tan ska rags m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: She who has that as a belt is Mamaki, who has the belt of qualities.

original: yang na yon tan ni byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba la sogs pa dang / bde ba'i sgra dang / sen mos 'debs pa dang / 'khyud pa dang tsumba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na yon tan ni byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba la sogs pa dang / bde ba'i sgra dang / sen mos 'debs pa dang / 'khyud pa dang tsumba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Or, the qualities are the skill in the movement of the thought of enlightenment, and so on, and the skill in the sounds of bliss, the scratching with nails, the embracing, the kissing, and so on.

original: bud med kyi mtshan nyid ni rked pa phra ba dang / smad sha shin du rgyas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi mtshan nyid ni rked pa phra ba dang / smad sha shin du rgyas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the woman are a slender waist, very full buttocks, and so on.

original: de rnams nyid ska rags gang la yod @73b pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ska rags gang la yod @73b pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has those is called a “girdle.”

original: de'i rjes la las dang dam tshig dag las de lta bu'i gang yang rung ba phyag rgya ma dang yang dag par sbyor la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la las dang dam tshig dag las de lta bu'i gang yang rung ba phyag rgya ma dang yang dag par sbyor la /
translated: After that, one should unite with a consort who is any of those kinds, either from the caste or from the samaya,

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong zhing bdag gi don byas la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel dang bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong zhing bdag gi don byas la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel dang bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor mchod par bya ste /
translated: and, having experienced the innate bliss by the stages of joy and so on, having done one’s own aim, one should worship the mandala in order to increase the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “The buddhas” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid phung po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid phung po ste /
translated: Buddha is the nature of the Tathagata, the aggregates.

original: de rnams kyi gnas ni ro gcig par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can kun rdzob kyi khams tha ma ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas ni ro gcig par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can kun rdzob kyi khams tha ma ste /
translated: Their abode is the final relative realm, characterized by the state of one taste.

original: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Peace is the nature of peace.

original: nam mkha' dbyings ni padma'i nam mkha' la rgyan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings ni padma'i nam mkha' la rgyan du gyur pa ste /
translated: The space realm is the space of the lotus, which is the ornament.

original: de'i dbang gis padma mdzes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis padma mdzes pa yin te /
translated: By its power, the lotus is beautiful.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji bzhin pad mtsho yid dga' ba //
analyzed: ji bzhin pad mtsho yid dga' ba //
translated: Just as a lotus lake is delightful,

original: ngang pa'i phreng ba rnams kyis mdzes //
analyzed: ngang pa'i phreng ba rnams kyis mdzes //
translated: Adorned by rows of geese,

original: de bzhin pad khong yid dga' ba //
analyzed: de bzhin pad khong yid dga' ba //
translated: So the space of the lotus is delightful,

original: byang chub sems kyis mdzes pa yin ;🔽/ zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyis mdzes pa yin ; / zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Adorned by the mind of enlightenment.

original: gdan bzhi las kyang /🔽zla ba med pas mtshan mo yin //
analyzed: gdan bzhi las kyang / zla ba med pas mtshan mo yin //
translated: And in the Catuhpitha Tantra:🔽Without the moon, there is no night.

original: mi mdzes zla ba mtshan med pas //
analyzed: mi mdzes zla ba mtshan med pas //
translated: Without the moon, there is no beauty.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And so on.

original: de nas de nyid padma'i snod du blangs te /
analyzed: de nas de nyid padma'i snod du blangs te /
translated: Then, taking it in the vessel of the lotus,

original: bshad ba la sogs pa rdzas bzhi po dang bsres la sngags rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: bshad ba la sogs pa rdzas bzhi po dang bsres la sngags rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Having mixed the four substances, such as the explanation, and so on, with the four substances, consecrate them with the mantras.

original: lha rnams ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams la phul bar byas nas /
analyzed: lha rnams ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams la phul bar byas nas /
translated: Having offered them to the deities, the mandala deities,

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang spyod par bya'o //
translated: one should also enjoy them oneself.

original: 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The result should be taught.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas ni /
translated: Thus, the buddhas

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor rnams te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor rnams te /
translated: are the mandala deities and the bodhisattva mandalas.

original: de rnams grags chen mnyes zhes pa ni grags pa chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de rnams grags chen mnyes zhes pa ni grags pa chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: Those are the great fame,

original: mnyes pa ni dgyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyes pa ni dgyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: pleasing,

original: sgrub pa po la mchog dang tha ma dang dad pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la mchog dang tha ma dang dad pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: granting the supreme and inferior powers to the adept.

original: bdag gi yang sangs rgyas ni phung po dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: bdag gi yang sangs rgyas ni phung po dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams te /
translated: Also, my buddhas are the aggregates, and the bodhisattvas are the sense organs such as the eyes, and so on.

original: de ltar byas nas mnyes pa ni rgas pa dang shi ba dang skra la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyis grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas mnyes pa ni rgas pa dang shi ba dang skra la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyis grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having done so, pleasing is being liberated from the diseases of aging, death, hair, and so on.

original: grags chen ni dus ring por gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grags chen ni dus ring por gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great becomes long-lasting.

original: padma'i rtse mo'i rgyud chen po las kyang /
analyzed: padma'i rtse mo'i rgyud chen po las kyang /
translated: And in the Great Lotus-Peak Tantra:

original: de ltar nyams su myong bas ni //
analyzed: de ltar nyams su myong bas ni //
translated: Thus, by experience,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: the nature of all Buddhas

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni @74a * //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni @74a * //
translated: is the five nectars.

original: lo gcig gam /
analyzed: lo gcig gam /
translated: One should practice for a year,

original: zla re zla phyed nyin re'am /
analyzed: zla re zla phyed nyin re'am /
translated: or a month, or a half-month, or a day,

original: rgas pa med cing skra dkar med //
analyzed: rgas pa med cing skra dkar med //
translated: without old age, without gray hair,

original: de bzhin dus min shi ba med //🔽'jig rten dbang phyug bzhin du ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dus min shi ba med // 'jig rten dbang phyug bzhin du ni //
translated: and likewise without untimely death.🔽One will be healthy and long-lived,

original: tshe dang nad med na sos 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang nad med na sos 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: like the Lord of the World.

original: de ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the practice.

original: yang na yongs su gsal ba ni shin tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: yang na yongs su gsal ba ni shin tu gsal ba ste /
translated: Or, the fully evident is the very evident.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: The mind-circle is the wheel of the three consciousnesses.

original: de shes nas mchog ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de shes nas mchog ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Having known that, the supreme is clear light.

original: de nyid kyis mchod pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum mi snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mchod pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum mi snang bar bya'o //
translated: By that very thing, the offering is the non-appearance of the three consciousnesses.

original: ji ltar zhen /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen /
translated: How is that?

original: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis//
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis//
translated: By the offering of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa ni lus ngag yid kyi rgyud gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs nye bar bsdus nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lus ngag yid kyi rgyud gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs nye bar bsdus nas so //
translated: Having thus summarized the nature of the assembly of the continuum of body, speech, and mind,

original: rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: the sequence will be explained.

original: lo grangs bcu drug ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lo grangs bcu drug ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sixteen years and so on.

original: sngar bshad pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug dang ldan pa'i snang ba chung ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rim pas /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug dang ldan pa'i snang ba chung ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rim pas /
translated: The sixteen moments explained previously are the sequence of the pristine consciousnesses of lesser appearance, and so on.

original: bud med ni dmigs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba thob nas de la zhugs te /
analyzed: bud med ni dmigs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba thob nas de la zhugs te /
translated: The woman is the attainment of the clear light, the nature of nonreferential wisdom.

original: mdangs ni zla ba la sogs pa'i snang ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: mdangs ni zla ba la sogs pa'i snang ba dang bral ba /
translated: The radiance is free from the appearances of the moon and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni nyon mongs pas ma gos pa'i snang bas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni nyon mongs pas ma gos pa'i snang bas /
translated: The pure nature is the appearance that is not sullied by afflictions.

original: bzang po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The good is the clear light.

original: dri ni sems 'khrugs par byed pa'i 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag go //
analyzed: dri ni sems 'khrugs par byed pa'i 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag go //
translated: The scent is the agitation of the mind, attachment and nonattachment.

original: me tog ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: me tog ni zhi ba ste /
translated: The flower is peace.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is nonattachment.

original: de dag gis brgyan te zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis brgyan te zhes pa ste /
translated: They are adorned with those.

original: de dag dang bral bar byas la /
analyzed: de dag dang bral bar byas la /
translated: Having separated from those,

original: de'i dbus su ste de dag gi nang du ni /
analyzed: de'i dbus su ste de dag gi nang du ni /
translated: In the middle of that, i.e., in the middle of those,

original: mnyes par bya ba ni nyams su myang bar bya'o//
analyzed: mnyes par bya ba ni nyams su myang bar bya'o//
translated: one should experience the pleasing, i.e., the object of experience.

original: de lta bu'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes byin gyis brlab pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes byin gyis brlab pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: The consecration of the intuition of that kind of clear light is the realization.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: m'a ma k'i ni zla ba dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dag go //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni zla ba dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dag go //
translated: The moon and the sun are the vowels and consonants.

original: yon tan ni nyi mchog drag dag go //
analyzed: yon tan ni nyi mchog drag dag go //
translated: The qualities are the supreme wrathful ones.

original: ska rags ni de gnyis ka dang bral ba'i dus mtshams kyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: ska rags ni de gnyis ka dang bral ba'i dus mtshams kyi snang ba ste /
translated: The belt is the appearance of the conjunction of the two.

original: de'i rim pa'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rim pa'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The sequence of that is the remainder of the sentence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas ni ye shes gsum ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas ni ye shes gsum ste /
translated: The abode of the Buddha is the three intuitions.

original: de nyid spro ba ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid spro ba ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: That itself is to be abandoned.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The realm of space is the clear light.

original: de nyid blang bar bya ba'i phyir brgyan te /
analyzed: de nyid blang bar bya ba'i phyir brgyan te /
translated: It is adorned for the sake of taking it up.

original: de ni blang bar bya'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //🔽bshang ba zhes pa ni yul rnams @74b so ;
analyzed: de ni blang bar bya'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o // bshang ba zhes pa ni yul rnams @74b so ;
translated: That is to be taken up is the remainder of the sentence.🔽The feces are the objects.

original: / gci ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: / gci ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The urine is the sense organs.

original: khrag ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: khrag ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Blood is passion.

original: khu ba la sogs pa gzhan ma rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: khu ba la sogs pa gzhan ma rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The others, semen and so on, are the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: de rnams / lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams / lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those are to be offered to the deities.

original: lha rnams zhes bya ba'i mang po'i tshig ni bsnyen bskur bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams zhes bya ba'i mang po'i tshig ni bsnyen bskur bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural in “deities” is for the sake of worship.

original: de bas na lha ni lha kun bskyed pa'i rgyu ste 'od gsal ba la dbul bar bya ba ni bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lha ni lha kun bskyed pa'i rgyu ste 'od gsal ba la dbul bar bya ba ni bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the deity, which is the cause of the generation of all deities, is to be offered into clear light.

original: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu ste /
translated: Thus, the Buddha is the three consciousnesses, and the Bodhisattvas are the one hundred and sixty natures.

original: de rnams mnyes pa ni thob par 'gyur ba dang / grags chen ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thob par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams mnyes pa ni thob par 'gyur ba dang / grags chen ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes thob par gyur pa ste /
translated: Their satisfaction is the attainment of the great fame of the attainment of the gnosis of the dharma-dhātu.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the purification of the mind.

original: yang na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Or else, the mind-maṇḍala and so on.

original: thugs ni lus te de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: thugs ni lus te de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ni bzhi ste /
translated: The mind is the body, and its maṇḍala is fourfold.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su gsal ba ni dmar po la sogs pa'i snang ba dang ldan pa shes nas mchod par bya ba ni spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su gsal ba ni dmar po la sogs pa'i snang ba dang ldan pa shes nas mchod par bya ba ni spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having understood that the maṇḍalas of earth, water, fire, and wind are fully evident, that is, endowed with the appearances of red and so forth, one should make offerings, that is, emanate them.

original: nan tan du zhes pa ni srog dang rtsol ba'i rlung dag g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: nan tan du zhes pa ni srog dang rtsol ba'i rlung dag g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu ba'o //
translated: “With effort” means that the winds of life and exertion move through the right and so forth.

original: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
translated: With the offerings of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lha mo spyan la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lha mo spyan la sogs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pas so //
translated: means that by the consecration of the goddesses Locanā and so forth, which are the nature of the body and so forth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: padma'i mgon po 'dir lha ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma'i mgon po 'dir lha ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, O Lotus Lord, the asuras and so forth.

original: lo grangs bcu drug ces pa ni dkyil 'khor re re la sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbye ba bzhi yin pas bcu drug go //
analyzed: lo grangs bcu drug ces pa ni dkyil 'khor re re la sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbye ba bzhi yin pas bcu drug go //
translated: Sixteen years means that each maṇḍala is divided into four by the divisions of earth and so forth, making sixteen.

original: yang na nyin mo dang mtshan mor thun phyed phyed dbye ba'i dus su byung bas thun brgyad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na nyin mo dang mtshan mor thun phyed phyed dbye ba'i dus su byung bas thun brgyad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, since it arises at the time of dividing the day and night into eight watches, the eight watches become sixteen.

original: de lta bu'i bud med ni dus te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bud med ni dus te /
translated: Such a woman is the time.

original: mdangs ni dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bzang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mdangs ni dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bzang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa ste /

original: de la brten nas dri dang me tog ni g-yon dang g-yas pa'i sna khung gis brgyan pa ni spro bar byas la g-yon dang g-yas kyi spro ba de nyid kyi dbus ni dal bus dang gnyi ga'i rgyu ba byas la mnyes par bya ba ni spro bar bya'o
analyzed: de la brten nas dri dang me tog ni g-yon dang g-yas pa'i sna khung gis brgyan pa ni spro bar byas la g-yon dang g-yas kyi spro ba de nyid kyi dbus ni dal bus dang gnyi ga'i rgyu ba byas la mnyes par bya ba ni spro bar bya'o

analyzed: // de lta bus byin gyis brlabs la m'a ma k'i ni gdong gi sna ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyi yon tan ni rtse mo ste der ska rags ni gnas pa ste / shes rab can ni @75a * //

analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid shes pas bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: de las kyang sangs rgyas gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs sems can gyi don du spro bar bya'o //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni nam mkha'i ngos te de brgyan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni nam mkha'i ngos te de brgyan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The realm of space is the surface of space, and that is the ornament.

original: de nas nye bar bsdus la /
analyzed: de nas nye bar bsdus la /
translated: Then, in brief,

original: bshang gci khu ba khrag la sogs //
analyzed: bshang gci khu ba khrag la sogs //

analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i ngo bo dkyil 'khor de rnams /

analyzed: lha rnams ni spyan la sogs pa dbul bar bya ba ni de'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //

original: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas ni /
translated: If that is done, the buddhas

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems ni bdag gi sems kyi skad cig ma ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyang grags chen ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum du shes par gyur te /
translated: Those are also the great fame, known in the three times of the past, future, and present.

original: tshig gi don te /
analyzed: tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o ;

analyzed: / yang na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni 'od gsal ba shes nas nan tan du sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: lus ni sbrul pa'i sku'o //

original: ngag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ngag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

translated: The offering of those is the grasping, that is, the taking of the illusory body, which is the nature of the three bodies.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bud med ni phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: bud med ni phyag rgya chen po'o //

translated: Having pervaded that, in the middle of that, in the middle of clear light, one should generate the delight.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: The Prajfiiipiiramitii says:🔽Just as the breath dissolves

analyzed: yang dang yang du rnal 'byor pas // yang dag mtha' la zhugs par bya //
translated: the yogi/ni

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs par byas la /
translated: Thus, the consecration of the great seal is made to enter into clear light.

analyzed: m'a ma k'i yon tan ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te de @75b nyid ska rags ni rgyan gang la yod pa de ni bzhin no //

analyzed: de lta bu byas nas sangs rgyas kyi gnas ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku /

analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni nam mkha' dang dkyil 'khor te de nyid brgyan par byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'od 'phro ba dang dbus kyi cha ru gnas pa ste spro bar bya'o //

analyzed: bshang ba ni stong pa nyid do // gci ba ni shin du stong pa nyid do //

original: khrag ni stong pa nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: khrag ni stong pa nyid chen po'o //

original: khu ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: khu ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid do //

translated: Having done so, the Buddha, the one who delights the sentient beings of the three realms, enters into the stages of the Joyful One and so forth, which are the capacities for hearing the Dharma, and becomes omniscient.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la /

original: byang chub ni sa bcu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni sa bcu gnyis pa ste /

analyzed: de la sems dpa' ni gnas pa gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o//
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o//
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

analyzed: yang yongs su gsal ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //

original: thugs ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba /
analyzed: thugs ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba /
translated: The mind is arisen from the clear light.

translated: The mandala is the illusory body. Having realized that, one should worship the three bodies, body, speech, and mind, with that, which should be characterized as clear light.

original: nan tan du ni bla ma'i man ngag gis so //
analyzed: nan tan du ni bla ma'i man ngag gis so //

original: de las man ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de las man ngag ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: lo grangs bcu drug pa ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin /
translated: A sixteen-year-old girl is the nature of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: bud med ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya /
analyzed: bud med ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya /
translated: A woman is a pledge seal.

analyzed: mdangs ni rang gi rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog gis bzang ba ni mdog mtshungs pa thob nas bsams te /

original: dri dang me tog ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo /
analyzed: dri dang me tog ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo /
translated: Her scent and flowers are day and night.

original: de dag gis brgyan pa ni mtshams kyi dus te blangs nas bla ma la dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brgyan pa ni mtshams kyi dus te blangs nas bla ma la dbul par bya'o //
translated: Adorned with those is the intermediate period. Having taken her, one should offer her to the guru.

original: des kyang phreng ba dang / chu dang / me long dang / cod pan dang / dar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang / ming dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / @76a * //
analyzed: des kyang phreng ba dang / chu dang / me long dang / cod pan dang / dar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / dril bu dang / ming dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / @76a * //
translated: Also, with that, the empowerment is conferred with a rosary, water, a mirror, a diadem, a hanging silk, a vajra, a bell, a name, an irreversible,

analyzed: gsang ba la sogs pas dbang bskur zhing des brjod pa'i gsol ba gdab pa dang bstod pa gsan nas thugs dang ba'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku dmigs pa'i slob ma de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: secret empowerment, and so on. Having listened to the supplication and praise expressed by that (disciple), the vajra master, with a delighted mind, should actualize the meditative concentration of Vajradhara and confer the vajra and bell upon that disciple who visualizes the body of Vairocana.

original: m'a ma k'i'i sku 'dzin pa des kyang dam tshig la sogs pa de la sbyin zhing rengs pa'i rdo rje rtse mo la zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i sku 'dzin pa des kyang dam tshig la sogs pa de la sbyin zhing rengs pa'i rdo rje rtse mo la zhugs par bya'o //
translated: That one who holds the body of Māmakī should also give the pledges, and so on, to that (disciple) and cause him to enter the tip of the immovable vajra.

original: dga' ba dang spu ldang ba skyes pa de yang blta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang spu ldang ba skyes pa de yang blta ste /
translated: That one who has generated joy and horripilation should also be seen.

original: de'i dus su ni mtshan phyed kyi dus su mnyes pa ni spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su ni mtshan phyed kyi dus su mnyes pa ni spyod par bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should engage in the conduct of pleasing (the deity) at midnight.

original: de byin gyis brlab pa ni de las dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa thob nas /
analyzed: de byin gyis brlab pa ni de las dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa thob nas /
translated: The consecration of that is the attainment of the example-simultaneously-born from that.

analyzed: yon tan ska rags m'a ma k'i ni 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid de dpe las 'byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The belt of qualities is Māmakī, the reality of clear light. The simultaneously-born arising from the example should be cultivated.

original: de nas sangs rgyas ni chags pa dang bral ba dag go //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas ni chags pa dang bral ba dag go //
translated: Then, the Buddhas are those free from attachment.

original: gnas ni chags pa bar pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni chags pa bar pa ste /
translated: The place is the middle attachment.

original: de dag spro ba ni spong bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spro ba ni spong bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be abandoned.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba mngon par byang chub pas brgyan pa ni bsgom mo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni 'od gsal ba mngon par byang chub pas brgyan pa ni bsgom mo //
translated: The realm of space is the clear light, which is the ornament of manifest enlightenment, which should be cultivated.

original: bshang gci ni ril por 'dzin pa ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bshang gci ni ril por 'dzin pa ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Feces and urine are the meditative stabilization of total retention.

original: khrag khu ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: khrag khu ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Blood and semen are the meditative stabilization of subsequent destruction.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis lha ni phung po rnams la phul bar bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis lha ni phung po rnams la phul bar bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: By means of those meditative stabilizations, the deity is to be offered to the aggregates, which is the clear light.

original: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa mnyes pa ni 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni gal te bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyang rim pa 'di sgom par byed na de'i tshe grags chen ni ye shes thob par 'gyur ba ste /
