translated: Thus, the Buddha is pleased, and the Bodhisattvas are also pleased if the practitioners of the stage of generation meditate on this stage.

original: mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: yang ni thugs ni sems te /
analyzed: yang ni thugs ni sems te /
translated: Again, mind is the thought.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pos dkyil 'khor ni rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su gsal ba ni the tshom med cing gsal bar shes te thob la /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pos dkyil 'khor ni rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su gsal ba ni the tshom med cing gsal bar shes te thob la /
translated: The mandala is purified and fully illuminated by the four stages of vajra repetition and so forth, without doubt and with clear understanding.

original: mchod pa ni zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
translated: Worship is the contemplation of union.

original: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
translated: By the worship of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa ni de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: since the conceptualizations of those are not perceived.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: lo grangs bcu drug ces pa ni skad cig ma bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: lo grangs bcu drug ces pa ni skad cig ma bcu drug yin te /
translated: Sixteen years is sixteen moments.

original: dper na dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang / lhan cig skyes dga' ste bzhi yin no //
analyzed: dper na dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang / lhan cig skyes dga' ste bzhi yin no //
translated: For example, there are four: joy, supreme joy, separation from joy, and innate joy.

original: de la dga' ba la ni chos @76b dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang ngo bo nyid de skad cig ma bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de la dga' ba la ni chos @76b dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang ngo bo nyid de skad cig ma bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: Among them, joy is the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, the Emanation Body, and the Essence Body, which are twelve moments.

original: de la yang dga' ba la ni chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dga' ba la ni chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhi yin te /
translated: Among them, joy is divided into four, such as small.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa'i dus su de rnams nyams su myang bar bya'o //🔽de la dga' ba chung ba'i dus su sprul pa'i sku'o ;
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa'i dus su de rnams nyams su myang bar bya'o // de la dga' ba chung ba'i dus su sprul pa'i sku'o ;
translated: At the time of their manifestation, they are to be experienced.🔽At the time of small joy, it is the Emanation Body.

original: / dga' ba bar pa'i dus su longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //🔽dga' ba rab kyi dus su chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: / dga' ba bar pa'i dus su longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o // dga' ba rab kyi dus su chos kyi sku'o //
translated: At the time of medium joy, it is the Enjoyment Body.🔽At the time of great joy, it is the Dharma Body.

original: dga' ba rab kyi rab kyi dus su ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste /
analyzed: dga' ba rab kyi rab kyi dus su ngo bo nyid kyi sku ste /
translated: At the time of very great joy, it is the Essence Body.

original: de ltar yang gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, it should be understood for the others as well.

original: gsum po'i skad cig ma bcu gnyis ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gsum po'i skad cig ma bcu gnyis ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The twelve moments of the three are mundane wisdom.

original: bzhi pa'i skad cig ma bzhi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i skad cig ma bzhi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The four moments of the fourth stage are supramundane gnosis.

original: de'i rjes la dag pa 'jig rten gyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la dag pa 'jig rten gyi ye shes te /
translated: After that, there is the pure mundane gnosis.

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gnosis that is attained subsequent to the supramundane gnosis arises in the yogi.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa las kyang zhes bya ba las khyad med pa'i ye shes kyi nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i chos kun mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa las kyang zhes bya ba las khyad med pa'i ye shes kyi nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i chos kun mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in One Letter, which is nonconceptual, it is said that “one sees all phenomena as like space, which is indivisible from gnosis.”

original: de'i rjes la thob par smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa dang 'dra ba'i chos kun mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob par smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa dang 'dra ba'i chos kun mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, one sees all phenomena as like a mirage, an illusion, a dream, an optical illusion, an echo, a reflection, the moon in water, and a magical creation.

original: de nas skad cig ma bcu drug nyams su myong ba mthar bud med ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste /
analyzed: de nas skad cig ma bcu drug nyams su myong ba mthar bud med ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste /
translated: Then, at the end of the experience of the sixteen moments, the woman is the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: mdangs ni 'od zer rnams kyis bzang ba ni shin tu gsal bar gyur pa thob nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mdangs ni 'od zer rnams kyis bzang ba ni shin tu gsal bar gyur pa thob nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having attained the excellent radiance, i.e., the light rays, one should meditate on the very clear.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dri ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / me tog ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: dri ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / me tog ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The scent is the conventional truth, and the flower is the ultimate truth.

original: de dag gis brgyan pa ni khyab cing de'i dbus su zhes pa ni de dag gi bar du tha mi dad pas mnyes par bya ba ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brgyan pa ni khyab cing de'i dbus su zhes pa ni de dag gi bar du tha mi dad pas mnyes par bya ba ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Adorned with those, in the middle of them, i.e., not different from them, one should please, i.e., meditate on, the body that has the nature of the non-duality of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku de lta bu shes rab can ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku de lta bu shes rab can ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: The wise one, i.e., the practitioner of the completion stage, having blessed that body, which has the nature of the non-duality of the conventional and the ultimate,

original: m'a ma k'i'i yon tan ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ska rags ni brgyan par byas la /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i yon tan ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ska rags ni brgyan par byas la /
translated: with the qualities of Māmakī, i.e., the vajra-like meditative stabilization, should be adorned with the belt.

original: sangs rgyas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / gnas ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / gnas ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The buddhas are the conventional truth, and the abode is the ultimate truth.

original: de dag spro ba ni ro gcig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spro ba ni ro gcig par bya'o //
translated: One should emanate those, i.e., make them one taste.

original: sku de nyid kyang zhi ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan @77a * //
analyzed: sku de nyid kyang zhi ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan @77a * //
translated: That kāya is also peaceful,🔽not remaining in nirvāṇa.🔽

original: las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very body is peaceful because of non-abiding nirvana.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni rab tu brgyan //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni rab tu brgyan //
translated: The realm of space is well adorned

original: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas spro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas spro ba'i phyir /
translated: means that because of the emission of infinite Buddhas,

original: bshad ci khu ba khrag la sogs //
analyzed: bshad ci khu ba khrag la sogs //
translated: semen, blood, and so on

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas smod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas smod pa'o //
translated: means that worldly people are contemptuous.

original: de bzhin du sogs pa'i sgras ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sogs pa'i sgras ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, and so on means milk and so on.

original: gzhan yang rigs ni bram ze dang gdol ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs ni bram ze dang gdol ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, caste is brahmin, untouchable, and so on.

original: rdzas ni gser dang sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas ni gser dang sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Substance is gold, earth, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyang lha rnams la dbye ba med pa'i sems kyis dbul bar bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyang lha rnams la dbye ba med pa'i sems kyis dbul bar bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the eight worldly dharmas of gain, non-gain, and so on should be known to be offered to the deities with a mind free of discrimination.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas gzhan du mi dmigs te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan du mi dmigs te //
translated: The Buddha is not perceived elsewhere,

original: 'jig rten khams ni gang yang rung //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni gang yang rung //
translated: in any world system whatsoever.

original: gang phyir sems ni sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir sems ni sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: Because mind is buddhahood itself.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud las kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud las kyang //
translated: And in the Tantra of All the Buddhas:🔽I am the nature of all the Buddhas,

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kun nyid dang // byang chub sems dpa' kun nyid dang // de phyir thams cad nan tan du //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kun nyid dang // byang chub sems dpa' kun nyid dang // de phyir thams cad nan tan du //
translated: I am the nature of all the Bodhisattvas,🔽Therefore, I should make offerings

original: rang gi bdag nyid rab mchod bya //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid rab mchod bya //
translated: to myself with all my being.🔽I am free from all faults,

original: skyon ni thams cad rnam grol dang // rnam rtog mun pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: skyon ni thams cad rnam grol dang // rnam rtog mun pa sel bar byed //
translated: I dispel the darkness of conceptualization,🔽I am the moon of mind,

original: nyon mongs dri ma kun dag pas //🔽zla bzhin sems kyi zla ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs dri ma kun dag pas // zla bzhin sems kyi zla ba yin //
translated: purified of all the stains of afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems ni lha yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i sems ni lha yin no //
translated: The nondual mind of reasoning is the deity.

original: de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas /
translated: Having done that,

original: sangs rgyas ni nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes pa ni legs pa'i sgra gsung ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes pa ni legs pa'i sgra gsung ba'am /
translated: the Buddhas, the Tathagatas dwelling in the sky, are pleased, and they speak words of praise,

original: 'od zer gyi 'khor los dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi 'khor los dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: or they confer empowerment with a circle of light rays.🔽The Bodhisattvas are the lords of the ten grounds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug / grags chen ni grags pa chen po'i sgra gsum pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug / grags chen ni grags pa chen po'i sgra gsum pa'am /
translated: The great fame is the third sound of great fame.

original: rnal 'byor pa la bstod ces ston to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la bstod ces ston to //
translated: The praise of the yogi is taught.

original: yang na sangs rgyas ni dus gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas ni dus gsum ste /
translated: Or, the Buddha is the three times;

original: de dag mnyes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la 'bad pa med pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mnyes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la 'bad pa med pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: pleasing is the yogi's mind engaging effortlessly.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dmigs pa la sogs pa ste /🔽de rnams kyang grags chen lha'i spyan la sogs pa thob pa phul du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dmigs pa la sogs pa ste / de rnams kyang grags chen lha'i spyan la sogs pa thob pa phul du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are the objective supports, and so on;🔽their greatness is the attainment of the divine eye, and so on, which is excellent.

original: zung 'jug gi rim pa'o //
analyzed: zung 'jug gi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The mind mandala is the Akṣobhya mandala.

original: de gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The chapter that is primarily about that is the mind mandala chapter, which is the stage of generation.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni snying po ste rdo rje bzlas @77b pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni snying po ste rdo rje bzlas @77b pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind mandala is the essence, which is vajra repetition, and so on.

original: de rnams len par byed pas na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams len par byed pas na thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: It takes up those, so it is the mind mandala, which is the stage of completion.

original: de gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: The chapter of the mind mandala is so called because the collection of words, with that as the main [topic], is the mind mandala.

original: rgyud 'grel las le'u bzhi pa'i tshig gi don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'grel las le'u bzhi pa'i tshig gi don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the sixteen topics of the fourth chapter of the explanatory tantra.

original: le'u bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni phyed dang sum brgya'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni phyed dang sum brgya'o /
translated: The number of verses in the fourth chapter is three and a half.

original: // / dkyil 'khor gyi dbang bskur ba thob nas spyod pa bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: // / dkyil 'khor gyi dbang bskur ba thob nas spyod pa bya bar rigs te /
translated: Having obtained the empowerment of the mandala, it is appropriate to engage in conduct.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa mchog gi le'u lnga pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa mchog gi le'u lnga pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the fifth chapter on the supreme conduct of mantra,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “thereupon,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni lnga ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni lnga ste ;
translated: All tathāgatas are five,

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs spros pa med pa'i spyod pas 'chang ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa la 'jug pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs te de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs spros pa med pa'i spyod pas 'chang ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa la 'jug pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs te de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa'o //
translated: and the one who holds them with the conduct of the unelaborated body, speech, and mind of those [tathāgatas] is the sixth tathāgata, the mind of the tathāgatas, who enters into the attainment of the stage of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'od gsal ba'i snang ba mdzes pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i snang ba mdzes pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: Since he is beautiful with the appearance of luminosity, he is the king.

original: kun ni ye shes gsum ste de rnams ni snang bar mdzad pas na kun mchog go //
analyzed: kun ni ye shes gsum ste de rnams ni snang bar mdzad pas na kun mchog go //
translated: All is the three intuitions. Since they are the illuminators, they are the best of all.

original: gnas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par pa ste /
translated: The places are the passionless and the passionate.

original: de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang sbyar bar mdzad pas na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang sbyar bar mdzad pas na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Since he is the one who unites them with the innate bliss, he is the lord of the places.

original: spyod pa kun ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: spyod pa kun ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: All practices are of three kinds:

original: spros pa dang bcas pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'o //
translated: with elaboration, without elaboration, and with extremely unelaborate practice.

original: de la spros pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa'i sgo nas chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la spros pa dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la nye bar longs spyod pa'i sgo nas chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the practice with elaboration is the one which causes the attainment of the manifest enlightenment of the Dharma-source by means of the enjoyment of the five sense-qualities.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i bza' ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i bza' ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The practice without elaboration is the one which causes the attainment of the manifest enlightenment of the Dharma-element by means of the food, etc. which are as many as there are.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i bza' ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni ji snyed pa'i bza' ba la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The extremely unelaborate conduct is the attainment of the manifest enlightenment of the realm of phenomena by means of the food, etc. , of however much is available.

original: spyod pa rnam pa gsum de dag thams cad la gnas shing gsal bar byed pa'i phyir kun mchog chos ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa gsum de dag thams cad la gnas shing gsal bar byed pa'i phyir kun mchog chos ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams te /
translated: Since all of those three kinds of conduct are present and are made clear, the supreme of all Dharmas are the worldly Dharmas.

original: de rnams kyi don ni dbyer med pa ston pas na chos kyi don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni dbyer med pa ston pas na chos kyi don to //
translated: Since the meaning of those is taught as being inseparable, it is the meaning of Dharma.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das sngar bshad pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das sngar bshad pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has taught the nature of the one who has the characteristics of the three kinds of conduct explained above.

original: rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang sems rnam par dag pa @78a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang sems rnam par dag pa @78a * //
translated: The vajra recitation, the purification of the mind,

original: dang ; sgrub pa po rnams so //
analyzed: dang ; sgrub pa po rnams so //
translated: and the practitioners.

original: yang na sku gsung thugs ni bshang ba dang gcin dang khrag go //
analyzed: yang na sku gsung thugs ni bshang ba dang gcin dang khrag go //
translated: Alternatively, the body, speech, and mind are feces, urine, and blood.

original: de rnams 'chang ba ni shu kra'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'chang ba ni shu kra'o //
translated: The one who holds those is semen.

original: rgyal po ni sha'o //
analyzed: rgyal po ni sha'o //
translated: The king is flesh.

original: kun mchog ni lcags kyu lnga'o //
analyzed: kun mchog ni lcags kyu lnga'o //
translated: The supreme of all is the five hooks.

original: gnas kyi dbang phyug ni yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi dbang phyug ni yi ge gsum ste /
translated: The lord of the abode is the three syllables.

original: de rnams sbyang ba dang / sang ba dang / 'bar ba'i mtshan nyid can spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams sbyang ba dang / sang ba dang / 'bar ba'i mtshan nyid can spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct is the purification, the purification, and the blazing of those.

original: des thob pa ni gang zhig mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: des thob pa ni gang zhig mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The attainment is the supreme nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: chos kyi don ni bdud rtsir bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don ni bdud rtsir bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is the nectar.

original: de lta bu'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdud rtsi bza' ba'i bya ba bka' stsal to zhes 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni bdud rtsi bza' ba'i bya ba bka' stsal to zhes 'brel pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of such conduct is the activity of consuming the nectar.

original: de ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment.

original: yang na sku gsung thugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na sku gsung thugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs gsum ste /
translated: Alternatively, the body, speech, and mind are the three families of the Tathagata.

original: de rnams srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin par byed pas na sku gsung thugs 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi sgo nas 'dzin par byed pas na sku gsung thugs 'chang ba ste /
translated: Since one holds those by means of the commitments of killing and so forth, one is the holder of the body, speech, and mind.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the unelaborated conduct.

original: rgyal po ni sangs rgyas kyi yum nges pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: rgyal po ni sangs rgyas kyi yum nges pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The king is the mother of the buddhas, having the characteristic of certainty.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the very unelaborated conduct.

original: dkon mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams te /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams te /
translated: The jewels are the commitment seals.

original: de dag gi gnas kyi dbang phyug ni dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas kyi dbang phyug ni dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
translated: The lord of their abode is the principal of the mandala.

original: de nyid kyi sgo nas gang zhig spyod pa kun ni 'khyud pa dang po byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgo nas gang zhig spyod pa kun ni 'khyud pa dang po byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ste /
translated: In that very way, the conduct of all is the action of the first embrace and so forth.

original: de nyid byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
translated: That is supreme because it is the cause of enlightenment.

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi don ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi don ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi chos nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is like that, for the sake of attaining the reality of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.🔽The meaning is the object of expression, and the characteristics of conduct with elaboration are taught.

original: don ni brjod par bya ba ste spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid bka' stsal to zhes dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: don ni brjod par bya ba ste spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i mtshan nyid bka' stsal to zhes dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The supreme mandala and the completion stage are like that.

original: rnam par mi rtog don las byung //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog don las byung //
translated: Arisen from the meaning of non-conceptuality,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'dir spyod pa la dang po dbang byed pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir spyod pa la dang po dbang byed pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, the conduct should be explained first.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is free from duality.

original: don ni sems kyi rgyud gang yin pa de las 'byung ba ni de bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs te gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa yin na /
analyzed: don ni sems kyi rgyud gang yin pa de las 'byung ba ni de bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs te gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa yin na /
translated: The meaning is that the yogin who is intent on the meditation of the samadhi that arises from any mental continuum,

original: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nye bar mtshon pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rigs can sna tshogs kyi nyon mongs pas 'khrug pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nye bar mtshon pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rigs can sna tshogs kyi nyon mongs pas 'khrug pa yin na yang /
translated: even though he is disturbed by various afflictions characterized by attachment, aversion, and delusion,

original: dngos grub mchog ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa ni thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa ni thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain the supreme power, the power of the Great Seal.

original: de bas na nyan thos pa la sogs @78b pa'i theg pa rnams las theg pa 'di ni mchog ste /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos pa la sogs @78b pa'i theg pa rnams las theg pa 'di ni mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, this vehicle is supreme among the vehicles of the Sravakas, etc.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bla na med de rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: bla na med de rnyed par dka' //
translated: it is unsurpassed and difficult to attain.

original: zhes bya ba ste tshig gi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: de ni bsgrub pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: This is the perfection stage.

original: 'dir ni man ngag 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni man ngag 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the instruction:

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas bdag nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa che bar bltas te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas bdag nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa che bar bltas te /
translated: The yogi who desires the spiritual power of the great seal should view desire, etc. as great.

original: de bas na byang chub thob pa'i phyir shing la sogs pas byas pa'i khang pa sum brtsegs byas la 'og khang la bza' ba dang btung ba sna tshogs byed pa gzhan la bar khang la glu dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa bzhag cing /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub thob pa'i phyir shing la sogs pas byas pa'i khang pa sum brtsegs byas la 'og khang la bza' ba dang btung ba sna tshogs byed pa gzhan la bar khang la glu dang rol mo mkhan la sogs pa bzhag cing /
translated: Therefore, in order to attain enlightenment, he should make a three-storied house of wood, etc., and in the lower story he should place various foods and drinks, in the middle story he should place singers, musicians, etc.,

original: yang khang la shin tu 'jam pa'i bya 'gan la skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste /
analyzed: yang khang la shin tu 'jam pa'i bya 'gan la skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste /
translated: and in the upper story he should sit cross-legged on a very soft cushion.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bskor ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bskor ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal mngon du bya'o //
translated: Surrounded by various pledge seals, he should manifest the pride of being Great Vajradhara.

original: lha mo de rnams kyis kyang rang gi bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: lha mo de rnams kyis kyang rang gi bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim pa'am /
translated: Those goddesses also should condense themselves into moon and vajra, etc.,

original: cig car gyi rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / gzugs dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: cig car gyi rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / gzugs dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams bsgoms te /
translated: One should visualize the great Vajradhara and the goddesses such as Form and Vajra Form in a simultaneous process.🔽One should generate the pride of being all the Tathagatas with the mantra Om I am the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pa ra ma tsu ba ri gha dhe ta sva bh'a wa a'a ta ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nga rgyal bskyed la 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro ba'i sbyor bas sems can gyi don
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pa ra ma tsu ba ri gha dhe ta sva bh'a wa a'a ta ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nga rgyal bskyed la 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro ba'i sbyor bas sems can gyi don
translated: One should perform the benefit of sentient beings with the yoga of emanating the wheel of light rays, and again gathering them.

original: byas la yang bsdus te de dang lhan cig tu phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: byas la yang bsdus te de dang lhan cig tu phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: One should make outer, inner, and secret offerings together with them.

original: de la re zhig dang po spyan la sogs pa'i gnas su dam tshig gi phyag rgya la aa rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhag cing gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yang de bzhin du bkod la /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po spyan la sogs pa'i gnas su dam tshig gi phyag rgya la aa rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhag cing gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yang de bzhin du bkod la /
translated: Therein, one should first place the A's in the locations of Locana and so forth, in the order of the commitments, and also arrange Form Vajra and so forth in the same way.

original: dbus su rang gi bdag nyid gnas shing spyan gyi rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas dga' ba dang sa'i khams rnam par dag cing m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo lha mo'i zhal bltas nas mchog tu dga' ba dang / chu'i khams rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: dbus su rang gi bdag nyid gnas shing spyan gyi rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas dga' ba dang sa'i khams rnam par dag cing m'a ma k'i'i ngo bo lha mo'i zhal bltas nas mchog tu dga' ba dang / chu'i khams rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: In the center, one should visualize the face of the goddess who is the nature of the eye, and one should meditate on the supreme joy of the pure earth element and the essence of Mamaki.

original: gos dkar mo'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas dga' bral dang me'i khams rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gos dkar mo'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas dga' bral dang me'i khams rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: One should visualize the face of the goddess who is the nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and one should meditate on the joy of the pure fire element and the nature of Tārā.

original: sgrol ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas shing lhan cig skyes pa dang rlung gi khams rnam par dag par bsgoms la /
analyzed: sgrol ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas shing lhan cig skyes pa dang rlung gi khams rnam par dag par bsgoms la /
translated: One should visualize the face of the goddess who is the nature of Locanā, and one should meditate on the innate joy of the pure wind element.

original: de'i rjes la gzugs rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas @79a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gzugs rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas @79a * //
translated: After that, one should visualize the face of the goddess who is the nature of Rūpavajrā,

original: nas mig gi dbang po'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong la sgra rdo rje ma'i lha mo'i zhal bltas nas rna ba'i dbang po'i rnam par dag pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: nas mig gi dbang po'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong la sgra rdo rje ma'i lha mo'i zhal bltas nas rna ba'i dbang po'i rnam par dag pa bsgoms la /
translated: and one should experience the great bliss of the eye sense-sphere. One should visualize the face of the goddess who is the nature of Śabdavajrā, and one should meditate on the purity of the ear sense-sphere.

original: dri rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas pas sna'i dbang po rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: dri rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas pas sna'i dbang po rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The goddesses who are the nature of smell vajra goddesses look at the face of the nose sense organ, which purifies the nose sense organ.

original: ro rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas /
analyzed: ro rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i zhal bltas nas /
translated: The goddesses who are the nature of taste vajra goddesses look at the face of the tongue sense organ,

original: lce'i dbang po rnam par bcing /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po rnam par bcing /
translated: which binds the tongue sense organ.

original: reg bya rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i nu ma dag gi sra ba'i rang bzhin reg pa sa'i ngo bo dang de'i mchu'i ro myang ba ni chu'i khams kyi ngo bo dang / de nyid kyi padma bsrubs pa las byung ba'i drod kyi reg pa ni me'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo'i nu ma dag gi sra ba'i rang bzhin reg pa sa'i ngo bo dang de'i mchu'i ro myang ba ni chu'i khams kyi ngo bo dang / de nyid kyi padma bsrubs pa las byung ba'i drod kyi reg pa ni me'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang /
translated: The goddesses who are the nature of touch vajra goddesses touch the breasts, which have the nature of solidity, the essence of earth; the taste of the lips is the essence of the water element; the heat that arises from rubbing the lotus is the nature of the fire element; and the movement of the breath is the nature of the wind element.

original: de nyid kyi ngang du rdo rje 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin dang / de nyid kyi nang gi cha ru 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi khong stong nyams su myong ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la de'i rjes la de nyid kyi yan lag dang nying lag gi mdzes pa'i gzugs blta ba ni gzugs kyi ngo bo dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngang du rdo rje 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin dang / de nyid kyi nang gi cha ru 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi khong stong nyams su myong ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la de'i rjes la de nyid kyi yan lag dang nying lag gi mdzes pa'i gzugs blta ba ni gzugs kyi ngo bo dang /
translated: After that, the view of the beautiful form of the major and minor limbs is the nature of form.🔽Listening to the sweet sound of bliss, like a cuckoo and so on, is the nature of sound.🔽The smell that arises from the lotus, like the smell of a lotus and utpala and so on, is the nature of smell.

original: dang pa dang khu byug la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i bde ba'i sgra snyan pa nyan pa ni sgra'i ngo bo dang de nyid kyi padma las 'byung ba'i padma dang autpala la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i dri ni dri'i ngo bo dang / padma'i rdzas kyi ro myang ba ni ro'i ngo bo dang /
analyzed: dang pa dang khu byug la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i bde ba'i sgra snyan pa nyan pa ni sgra'i ngo bo dang de nyid kyi padma las 'byung ba'i padma dang autpala la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i dri ni dri'i ngo bo dang / padma'i rdzas kyi ro myang ba ni ro'i ngo bo dang /
translated: The taste of the substance of the lotus is the nature of taste.

original: de nyid 'khyud pa'i mtshan nyid ni reg bya'i ngo bo nyams su myong la phyi rol gyi mchod pa rnam lnga nye bar bsdus la tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mchod pas lha mo'i 'khor lo yang dag par tshim ste mchod cing bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu khar bcug la
analyzed: de nyid 'khyud pa'i mtshan nyid ni reg bya'i ngo bo nyams su myong la phyi rol gyi mchod pa rnam lnga nye bar bsdus la tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mchod pas lha mo'i 'khor lo yang dag par tshim ste mchod cing bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu khar bcug la
translated: The characteristic of embracing that very [consort] is experiencing the essence of touch. Having gathered the external five offerings, one should please the wheel of goddesses with the offering of the gaṇacakra and place the pill of the five nectars in one's mouth.

original: rol mo la sogs pas sems dpa' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rol mo la sogs pas sems dpa' bar bya'o //
translated: One should be courageous with music and so forth.

original: spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po ni rdo rje'i glu mdzad cing sems dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po ni rdo rje'i glu mdzad cing sems dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: The four goddesses such as Locanā sing vajra songs and delight the mind.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma ni nu ma bstan pas dbus kyi gtso bo mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma ni nu ma bstan pas dbus kyi gtso bo mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Rūpavajrā delights the principal figure in the center by displaying her breasts.

original: sgra rdo rje ma ni pi wang gi rol mas mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra rdo rje ma ni pi wang gi rol mas mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Śabdavajrā delights him with the music of the vīṇā.

original: dri rdo rje ma ni tsandan dang aa ka ru dang ga pur dang / me tog tsam pa ka la sogs pas dgyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dri rdo rje ma ni tsandan dang aa ka ru dang ga pur dang / me tog tsam pa ka la sogs pas dgyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Gandhavajrā delights him with sandalwood, agarwood, camphor, champak flowers, and so forth.

original: ro rdo rje ma ni bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i snod phul bas mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ro rdo rje ma ni bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i snod phul bas mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Rasavajrā delights him by offering a vessel filled with the five nectars.

original: reg bya rdo rje ma ni 'khyud pa'i bya bas mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma ni 'khyud pa'i bya bas mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: The tactile-vajra woman is pleased by the action of embracing.🔽After that, the yogī consecrates all those goddesses with the seed syllables of the five families in the manner of the principal figure in the center.

original: de'i rjes la rnal 'byor pas dbus kyi gtso bo'i tshul gyis lha mo de dag thams cad rigs lnga'i @79b sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la rim gyis de dag dang lhan cig tu 'khyud pa dang tsum ba na rnam pa brgyad du byas la mig dang
analyzed: de'i rjes la rnal 'byor pas dbus kyi gtso bo'i tshul gyis lha mo de dag thams cad rigs lnga'i @79b sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la rim gyis de dag dang lhan cig tu 'khyud pa dang tsum ba na rnam pa brgyad du byas la mig dang
translated: Then, he gradually performs the eight acts of embracing and kissing together with them.

original: lcags kyu dang gdan dag mdzub mo gnyis de nyid kyi padma'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang gdan dag mdzub mo gnyis de nyid kyi padma'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: The eyes, hook, and seat are the two index fingers inserted into the lotus of that [goddess].

original: 'dod pa'i gdugs ni de srid bskyod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gdugs ni de srid bskyod par bya'o //
translated: The parasol of desire is moved to that extent.

original: ji srid du grang ba ma yin pa'i reg pa nyams su myong bar skyed pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du grang ba ma yin pa'i reg pa nyams su myong bar skyed pa'o //
translated: Until the experience of a non-cold touch arises,

original: drod kyi rig pa nyams su myong ba thob la padma g-yo ba'i 'dab ma'i tshul du bdud rtsi de lces nyams su myong zhing 'khyud la sen mo dang sos 'debs pa ni rnam pa brgyad du byas la /
analyzed: drod kyi rig pa nyams su myong ba thob la padma g-yo ba'i 'dab ma'i tshul du bdud rtsi de lces nyams su myong zhing 'khyud la sen mo dang sos 'debs pa ni rnam pa brgyad du byas la /
translated: the experience of the heat is attained. The nectar is tasted with the tongue in the manner of moving petals of the lotus. The eight acts of embracing, biting with the teeth, and scratching with the fingernails are performed.

original: 'phyang mo nyug dang yan lag 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i byed pa rnams kyis rdo rje bcing ba byas la /🔽'dod chags la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon du byas la /
analyzed: 'phyang mo nyug dang yan lag 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i byed pa rnams kyis rdo rje bcing ba byas la / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon du byas la /
translated: Through the actions of shaking, shaking the limbs, and so on, one should perform the vajra binding.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags rmi lam bzhin du dmigs shing de nas cig car du langs te ro de nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags rmi lam bzhin du dmigs shing de nas cig car du langs te ro de nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan
translated: Through the stages of passion and so on, one should actualize the deity and recite the mantra, “Oṃ, I am of the nature of the vajra of the passion of all tathāgatas.”

original: lnga pos rang dang gzhan rnams mchod cing gzhan gyi don byas te /
analyzed: lnga pos rang dang gzhan rnams mchod cing gzhan gyi don byas te /
translated: Then, one should suddenly arise and, with the pride of being Great Vajradhara, one should worship oneself and others with the five sense objects and perform the welfare of others.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor bas lha mo longs spyod pa'i bde bas mngon par byang chub kyi bde ba thob ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor bas lha mo longs spyod pa'i bde bas mngon par byang chub kyi bde ba thob ste /
translated: The practitioner of the passion type attains the bliss of manifest enlightenment through the bliss of enjoying the goddess.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the elaborate purification.

original: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog don ni dngos po thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog don ni dngos po thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the nonconceptual meaning is the complete abandonment of all things.

original: de las byung ba ni ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: The yogis who have attained the knowledge that arises from that are the ones who have attained the supreme power.

original: 'dod chags ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'am /
translated: The yogis who are of the family of Amitābha,

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs can nam /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs can nam /
translated: or of the family of Amoghasiddhi,

original: rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rigs can gyi sgrub pa po rnams kyis dngos grub rab mchog ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa la brten te /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rigs can gyi sgrub pa po rnams kyis dngos grub rab mchog ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa la brten te /
translated: should attain the supreme power by means of the conduct that is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: theg pa'i mchog ni mngon par byang chub 'grub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa'i mchog ni mngon par byang chub 'grub par byed pa ste /
translated: The supreme vehicle is that which brings about the accomplishment of manifest enlightenment.

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: It is the generation and perfection stages.🔽First, the yogi, free from the concepts of pure and impure, realizes that all things are selfless dharmas by the guru’s instructions.

original: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pas bla ma'i man ngag gis dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'i chos rtogs pas 'od gsal ba'i snang ba gsal te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pas bla ma'i man ngag gis dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'i chos rtogs pas 'od gsal ba'i snang ba gsal te /
translated: The light of clear luminosity

original: lo'am zla ba drug gam /
analyzed: lo'am zla ba drug gam /
translated: is attained in one year, or six months,

original: gsum mam / bzhi'am /
analyzed: gsum mam / bzhi'am /
translated: or three, or four,

original: gcig gam / zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: gcig gam / zla ba phyed dam /
translated: or one, or half a month,🔽or in one day and night,🔽or in one day,🔽or in half a day,🔽or in one moment.

original: zhag bdun gyis bsnyen bkur rab kyis de bzhin gshegs @80a * //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis bsnyen bkur rab kyis de bzhin gshegs @80a * //
translated: In seven days, through the best service, one will receive a prophecy from the tathagatas.

original: pa'i lung bstan pas dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma blangs te /
analyzed: pa'i lung bstan pas dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma blangs te /
translated: One should not take the pledge seal with her.

original: de dang lhan cig tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rim pa 'dis spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rim pa 'dis spyad par bya ste /
translated: One should practice the conduct without elaboration with her by this process.

original: smyon pa'i brtul zhugs blangs te tshem bu gyon la ru dr'a ksha'i phreng bas lkog ma rnam par brgyan te /
analyzed: smyon pa'i brtul zhugs blangs te tshem bu gyon la ru dr'a ksha'i phreng bas lkog ma rnam par brgyan te /
translated: One should take up the practice of a madman, wear a patchwork cloak, and ornament one’s throat with a rudraksha rosary.

original: thal pa'i thig le gsum pos dpral bar mtshan te /
analyzed: thal pa'i thig le gsum pos dpral bar mtshan te /
translated: One should mark one’s forehead with three horizontal lines of ash.

original: thal bas yan lag bskus pas thal ba dang ldan pa'i snod kyis mchan khung mtshan pa /
analyzed: thal bas yan lag bskus pas thal ba dang ldan pa'i snod kyis mchan khung mtshan pa /
translated: One should smear one’s limbs with ash, and mark one’s armpits with a vessel of ash.

original: gseg shang gi sgra sgrogs shing gdol pa'i rigs nga yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi reg pa spangs la 'gal ba'i bza' ba spyod pas bdag po med pa'i sa phyogs su gnas pa rang dbang du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gseg shang gi sgra sgrogs shing gdol pa'i rigs nga yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi reg pa spangs la 'gal ba'i bza' ba spyod pas bdag po med pa'i sa phyogs su gnas pa rang dbang du spyod pa'o //
translated: One should proclaim the sound of a khaṭvāṅga and, having abandoned worldly concerns, one should live in a place without an owner, practicing the conduct of freedom, eating whatever is prohibited, and saying, “I am of the candāla caste.”

original: gal te rnam par snang mdzad la mos pa dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe ral pa'i cod pan byas la shing ngam sa la sogs pa'i g-yas dang g-yon du dong pa btags pa bzhin du phyag dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa rdul dkar pos de'i mdog 'dzin pa'o
analyzed: gal te rnam par snang mdzad la mos pa dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe ral pa'i cod pan byas la shing ngam sa la sogs pa'i g-yas dang g-yon du dong pa btags pa bzhin du phyag dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa rdul dkar pos de'i mdog 'dzin pa'o
translated: If one is devoted to Vairocana, then one should make a topknot and hold the hand implements and emblems, white in color, like a stick or earth, etc., on the right and left sides.🔽If one is a yogin of Cittavajra, etc., then one should make the consort similar to oneself, holding the same color, hand implements, and form.

original: // gal te thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang tshul 'dzin pas phyag rgya ma'ang de dang 'dra bar byas la 'jig rten gyi chos rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nags tshal la slong
analyzed: // gal te thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang tshul 'dzin pas phyag rgya ma'ang de dang 'dra bar byas la 'jig rten gyi chos rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nags tshal la slong
translated: One should go to the forest, free from worldly thoughts,

original: mo slong zhing lha ma yin pa'i bu mo rnams de la slong mo ster te /
analyzed: mo slong zhing lha ma yin pa'i bu mo rnams de la slong mo ster te /
translated: and beg for alms. The daughters of the asuras will give alms to him.

original: de za zhing phyag rgya ma de dang lhan cig tu de srid du ting nge 'dzin la goms par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de za zhing phyag rgya ma de dang lhan cig tu de srid du ting nge 'dzin la goms par bya ba ste /
translated: Eating that, one should practice samādhi with that consort for as long as one wishes.

original: ji srid du rdzu 'phrul rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du rdzu 'phrul rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain the magical powers.

original: de thob nas de kho na nyid brtan par shes te /
analyzed: de thob nas de kho na nyid brtan par shes te /
translated: Having attained that, one knows reality to be stable.

original: 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir smin pa dang / grol ba dang brtan pa'i rnam pas zhi ba la sogs pa dang / phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sems can rnams la ster bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir smin pa dang / grol ba dang brtan pa'i rnam pas zhi ba la sogs pa dang / phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sems can rnams la ster bar byed pa ste /
translated: In order to benefit migrating beings, one bestows upon sentient beings the powers of the great seal, etc., through the aspects of maturation, liberation, and stability.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct free of elaboration.

original: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog don ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog don ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Likewise, the meaning of nonconceptuality is unobstructed pristine consciousness.

original: de las 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ni bskyed pa ste ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma'o //
translated: That which arises from that is the creation, the pristine consciousness seal.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi rigs ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bo phyag rgya ma de dang snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi rigs ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i ngo bo phyag rgya ma de dang snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: One enters into union with that seal, whose nature is Vajradhatviśvarī, the family of desire, hatred, and confusion.

original: dngos grub rab mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa ni sten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub rab mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid sgrub par byed pa ni sten par byed pa'o //
translated: One accomplishes the supreme power, the nature of Mahāvajradhara, which is the practice.

original: theg @80b pa'i mchog ni bla med pa //
analyzed: theg @80b pa'i mchog ni bla med pa //
translated: The supreme vehicle is the unsurpassed.

original: zhes pa ni de nyid bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub mngon du byed pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub mngon du byed pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that he actualizes the unsurpassed manifest enlightenment.

original: de ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the summary of the meaning:

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa mngon du bya bar 'dod na dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba la zhugs te cig car du sgyu ma lta bu'i
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa mngon du bya bar 'dod na dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba la zhugs te cig car du sgyu ma lta bu'i
translated: The practitioner of the perfection stage of the creation stage, who wishes to manifest the conduct of the perfection stage, enters into the clear light, which is the nature of all things, the realm of reality, and instantaneously, in the manner of an illusion,

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten te /
translated: he relies on the meditative concentration of the illusory body.

original: rang gi thugs ka nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma spros la de dang lhan cig tu bsam gtan gyi bza' ba can gyi phyi rol gyi bza' ba la mi ltos pa gang yang rung ba'i gnas su gnas
analyzed: rang gi thugs ka nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma spros la de dang lhan cig tu bsam gtan gyi bza' ba can gyi phyi rol gyi bza' ba la mi ltos pa gang yang rung ba'i gnas su gnas
translated: From his heart he emanates the wisdom-consort, who is the essence of the perfection of wisdom, and together with her he abides in any place whatsoever,

original: shing gang yang rung ba'i gos gyon pa /
analyzed: shing gang yang rung ba'i gos gyon pa /
translated: wearing any clothes whatsoever,

original: gang yang rung ba smra ba ci 'dod pa spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smra ba ci 'dod pa spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is a madman who does whatever he wants, who acts as he pleases,🔽who is free of the elaborations of mantra and mudra.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i spros pa spangs pa smyon pa 'di yin no zhes 'jig rten pas dgod cing lta ba /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i spros pa spangs pa smyon pa 'di yin no zhes 'jig rten pas dgod cing lta ba /
translated: He is laughed at and looked at by the world.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos la sems mnyam pa chu la sa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sa la yang nub pa dang / 'byung bar byed cing 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i yid dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi chos la sems mnyam pa chu la sa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sa la yang nub pa dang / 'byung bar byed cing 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i yid dga' bar byed pa /
translated: His mind is even in worldly phenomena, such as happiness and suffering, and he moves on water as if it were earth, and he sinks into and moves on earth, and he delights the minds of beings by blazing, shining, and so on.🔽He is skilled in the activities of union, such as invisibility, and so on.

original: mi snang ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bya ba la mkhas pa /🔽ji lta bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pas tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi 'dam bu 'joms pa sngar bshad pa'i mtshan ma shin tu gsal bar mthong bas /
analyzed: mi snang ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bya ba la mkhas pa /🔽ji lta bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pas tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi 'dam bu 'joms pa sngar bshad pa'i mtshan ma shin tu gsal bar mthong bas /

original: des dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rtogs nas sdug bsngal gsum gyis mnan pa'i 'gro ba rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed cing 'od zer spro ba'i sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: des dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rtogs nas sdug bsngal gsum gyis mnan pa'i 'gro ba rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed cing 'od zer spro ba'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: Having realized that, one generates great compassion for transmigrating beings who are oppressed by the three sufferings and engages in the yoga of emitting light rays.🔽 🔽

original: chos bstan pa'i sgo nas de nyid phyas la bcud kyis len la sogs pas lus brtan par bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i sgo nas de nyid phyas la bcud kyis len la sogs pas lus brtan par bya ba'am /
translated: Having realized that one has attained power, one generates great compassion for transmigrators who are oppressed by the three sufferings, and one engages in the yoga of emitting light rays, or by means of teaching the doctrine, one stabilizes one's body by means of the elixir of life, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi grong la zhugs te yun ring du sems can gyi don bya ste shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi grong la zhugs te yun ring du sems can gyi don bya ste shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Or, having entered another's town, one acts for the sake of sentient beings for a long time. This is the extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: spyod pa gsum po de dag gis mngon par byang chub pa gsum rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa gsum po de dag gis mngon par byang chub pa gsum rnal 'byor pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: By means of those three conducts, the three manifest enlightenments are to be accomplished by the yogi/nī.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du /
translated: And in the Analysis of Action it says:

original: chos 'byung mngon par byang chub pa //
analyzed: chos 'byung mngon par byang chub pa //
translated: Enlightenment in the source of phenomena🔽is the conduct of the great,

original: 'dod chags rlung sogs rgya che @81a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags rlung sogs rgya che @81a * //
translated: the wind of passion, and so on.

original: ba // chos dbyings mngon par byang chub pa //
analyzed: ba // chos dbyings mngon par byang chub pa //
translated: Enlightenment in the phenomena source🔽is the conduct of the middling.🔽Enlightenment in the great seal

original: ji snyed pa yi spyod pa yis //
analyzed: ji snyed pa yi spyod pa yis //
translated: is the conduct of the small.

original: bla med mngon par byang chub pa //
analyzed: bla med mngon par byang chub pa //
translated: Enlightenment in the phenomena source🔽is the conduct of the small.

original: mngon par byang chub sbyor bas so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub sbyor bas so //
translated: By the application of manifest enlightenment.

original: spros pa la sogs spyod pa yis //
analyzed: spros pa la sogs spyod pa yis //
translated: By the conduct of elaboration, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams slob par phyed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams slob par phyed //
translated: The yogis and yoginis are divided into trainees and non-trainees.

original: ces 'byung ngo// 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi theg par nyan thos pa'i byang chub bzhin du byang chub rnams tha dad par ma gsungs na /
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo// 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi theg par nyan thos pa'i byang chub bzhin du byang chub rnams tha dad par ma gsungs na /
translated: Well then, if the Bhagavat did not teach the enlightenments to be different in the Mantra Vehicle, as they are in the Sravakayana,🔽how is it that he taught three enlightenments?

original: de ji ltar byang chub gsum gsungs so zhe na de ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar byang chub gsum gsungs so zhe na de ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: That is not a fault,

original: thabs kyi dbye ba dang spyod pa'i dbye bas 'bras bu tha dad pa tsam du bstan gyi /
analyzed: thabs kyi dbye ba dang spyod pa'i dbye bas 'bras bu tha dad pa tsam du bstan gyi /
translated: because he taught that the result is merely different due to the division of methods and the division of conduct.

original: don dam par 'bras bu ni gcig kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu ni gcig kho na yin gyi /
translated: The result is ultimately only one,

original: sgo du ma la sogs pa'i grong khyer chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: sgo du ma la sogs pa'i grong khyer chen po bzhin no //
translated: like a great city with many gates, etc.

original: de ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs te /
translated: That is taught.

original: da ni spyod pa gsum gyi rten du gyur pa sngags kyi theg pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs ngan smyig ma mkhan la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa gsum gyi rten du gyur pa sngags kyi theg pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs ngan smyig ma mkhan la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the greatness of the Mantra Vehicle, which is the basis of the three conducts, he says, “Even those of low caste, such as bamboo workers, etc.,” and so on.

original: gang zhig dgon pa'i lam du gzhan ma rnams la sol ba dang ldan pa drag po'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dgon pa'i lam du gzhan ma rnams la sol ba dang ldan pa drag po'i las byed pa'o //
translated: Those who, on the path of the monastery, do violent actions with charcoal for others.

original: smyig ma mkhan ni drag po'i sems ngang ldan pa rigs lnga pa ste kye 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: smyig ma mkhan ni drag po'i sems ngang ldan pa rigs lnga pa ste kye 'chad pa'o //
translated: The bamboo worker is the one with a violent mind, of five types, O speaker.

original: de bzhin du sogs pa'i sgras ni ri brags pa dang / khyir ba dang / nya shor pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sogs pa'i sgras ni ri brags pa dang / khyir ba dang / nya shor pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the term “etc.” includes the mountain dweller, the dog keeper, the fisherman, and so on.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gsod don don gnyer sems pa rnams //
analyzed: gsod don don gnyer sems pa rnams //
translated: Those who think of killing as a means of livelihood.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the verse,

original: gsod pa'i don srog gcod pas don ni bdag nyid 'tsho ba sems pa ni bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i don srog gcod pas don ni bdag nyid 'tsho ba sems pa ni bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: the means of killing is the means of livelihood by killing. Thinking is the performance of the action.

original: de rnams kyang theg mchog 'di la zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las phul du byung ba'i theg pa chen po 'di la spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi gzhir gyur pas bla na med pa ni mngon par byang chub rnam pa gsum sbyin pa'i
analyzed: de rnams kyang theg mchog 'di la zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las phul du byung ba'i theg pa chen po 'di la spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi gzhir gyur pas bla na med pa ni mngon par byang chub rnam pa gsum sbyin pa'i
translated: And those who are engaged in this supreme vehicle, in this Great Vehicle that is superior to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and so on, are the basis of the three types of practice. Therefore, the unsurpassed is the gift of the three types of manifest enlightenment.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa la 'gyur ba ni rdo rje 'chad chen po'i sa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa la 'gyur ba ni rdo rje 'chad chen po'i sa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is endowed with the power will attain the stage of the great vajra holder.

original: mtshams med ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshams med ba ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five heinous acts.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye ba'i mtshams med pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye ba'i mtshams med pa lnga ste /
translated: The words “and so on” refer to the five near heinous acts.🔽The bodhisattvas are afflicted by discursive thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa yin no zhes de bzhin du sdig pa chen por byed pa ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas 'phrogs pa'i sems can rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par rtog pa nyon mongs pa yin no zhes de bzhin du sdig pa chen por byed pa ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas 'phrogs pa'i sems can rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa'i
translated: Thus, those who commit great evil, such as sentient beings who steal the property of the Three Jewels, also have three types of conduct, as before, with the conduct of the mind being the most important.

original: sngags kyi @81b theg pa chen po la brten te /
analyzed: sngags kyi @81b theg pa chen po la brten te /
translated: They rely on the Mahayana of Mantra.

original: byang chub chen po 'grub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'grub par byed pa ste /
translated: They accomplish great awakening.

original: spyod pa'i mthu brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa'i mthu brtan pa yin no //
translated: This is the stability of the power of conduct.

original: de ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is the accomplishment.

original: yang na rigs ngan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rigs ngan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Or, the low caste is the fundamental consciousness.

original: 'khor ba'i dgon par bzhag cing dmyal ba'i ral gris sems can rnams gsod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dgon par bzhag cing dmyal ba'i ral gris sems can rnams gsod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is placed in the wilderness of samsara and kills sentient beings with the sword of hell.

original: / smyig ma mkhan ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: / smyig ma mkhan ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The bamboo-worker is the afflicted mental consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi'i mtshon chas 'gro ba'i phyugs gsod cing za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi'i mtshon chas 'gro ba'i phyugs gsod cing za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it kills and eats the cattle of the world with the weapons of the four afflictions.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri dags pa dang khyi rab dang shor ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri dags pa dang khyi rab dang shor ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes the consciousnesses of the deer, the dog, the thief, and so on.

original: yul la sogs pa'i za ba sbyin pa tsam gyis sems can ri dags dang nya rnams gsod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i za ba sbyin pa tsam gyis sems can ri dags dang nya rnams gsod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it kills the deer and fish of sentient beings by giving them objects and so on.

original: de rnams gsod don ni ye shes gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnams gsod don ni ye shes gsum ste /
translated: The purpose of killing them is the three wisdoms.

original: de rnams kyi yang don ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang don ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The purpose of those is clear light.

original: de gsal ba ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de gsal ba ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The manifestation of that is the accomplishment of the yogins who cultivate the state of clear light, which is the attainment of the great seal.

original: theg pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: theg pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Supreme vehicle” and so on are as before.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the purification of the mind.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa mtshan ma lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa mtshan ma lnga ste /
translated: Signlessness is the five signs such as mirage,

original: de 'das ma thag tu de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'das ma thag tu de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is attained immediately after that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus mtshams dang mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus mtshams dang mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar pa'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include the nature of the junctions, nights, and days, and attachment, detachment, and middling attachment.

original: de rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: sems can ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are conceptual.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sdig pa chen po ni skyes pa 'od gsal ba'i snang ba dga' ba'i ngo bo ye shes kyis mi snang bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni sdig pa chen po byed pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sdig pa chen po ni skyes pa 'od gsal ba'i snang ba dga' ba'i ngo bo ye shes kyis mi snang bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni sdig pa chen po byed pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, the great sinners are those who obscure the light of the clear light, which is the nature of joy, with the great sin. They are the yogis of the stage of completion.

original: de lta bus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par byed pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de lta bus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par byed pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught that they will accomplish the power of the great seal.

original: de ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten pa'i spyod pas thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten pa'i spyod pas thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Are all [goals] accomplished by the conduct based on the Great Vehicle of Mantra?

original: snying nas slob dpon smad pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: snying nas slob dpon smad pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [The reply is,] beginning with Those who sincerely disparage the master, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te /🔽rig pa'i dbang la sogs dbang @82a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te / rig pa'i dbang la sogs dbang @82a * //
translated: Because, beginning from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment,🔽one has obtained the very nature of the initiations, such as the knowledge-initiation,

original: bskur ba rnams kyi de kho na nyid the tshom med pa nyid thob cing shes rab kyi khyad par 'di bdag rang yin te /
analyzed: bskur ba rnams kyi de kho na nyid the tshom med pa nyid thob cing shes rab kyi khyad par 'di bdag rang yin te /
translated: and this special wisdom is oneself.

original: bdag gis thams cad shes pas 'dis ci bgyi'o zhes /
analyzed: bdag gis thams cad shes pas 'dis ci bgyi'o zhes /
translated: Thinking, I know everything, so what is the use of this?

original: gang gis bla ma smod pa de ni slob dpon smod pa dag go //
analyzed: gang gis bla ma smod pa de ni slob dpon smod pa dag go //
translated: those who disparage the guru are disparaging the master.

original: de rnams gal te rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa la brten te nam yang theg pa 'di ni sngags kyi theg pa la 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams gal te rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa la brten te nam yang theg pa 'di ni sngags kyi theg pa la 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they rely on the conduct of the three [types of practitioners], they will never accomplish this vehicle, the vehicle of mantra.

original: gang gi phyir des ni de nyid las dam tshig blangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des ni de nyid las dam tshig blangs te /
translated: Because they have taken the commitments from that [master],

original: khyod kyis bdag ni smod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag ni smod par mi bya'o //
translated: [the master] will not disparage them.

original: dka' ba ma spangs pas dus byas te khyod dmyal bar ltung ba re /
analyzed: dka' ba ma spangs pas dus byas te khyod dmyal bar ltung ba re /
translated: You have not abandoned hardship and have died. You have fallen into hell.🔽

original: de lta bu yang khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de lta bu yang khas blangs nas /
translated: Having taken such a vow,🔽if you act in that way, then by your own words you will lose your spiritual power.

original: gal te de bzhin du byed na de'i phyir de la rang gi ngag gis dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du byed na de'i phyir de la rang gi ngag gis dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus it is intended.🔽Similarly, in the seventeen chapters of this very tantra,

original: de bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po dang slob dpon tha mi dad par rgyud 'di nyid la le'u bcu bdun pa las 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po dang slob dpon tha mi dad par rgyud 'di nyid la le'u bcu bdun pa las 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: it is explained that the master is not different from Great Vajradhara,

original: kho bo cag sangs rgyas la pha yin pa dang ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag sangs rgyas la pha yin pa dang ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: saying, “We are the father and mother of the Buddha.”

original: de bzhin du gdan bzhi las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gdan bzhi las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Catuhpitha Tantra also says:

original: slob dpon la ni yon tan smra //
analyzed: slob dpon la ni yon tan smra //
translated: Speak of the master’s good qualities,

original: skyon ni nam yang ma yin te //
analyzed: skyon ni nam yang ma yin te //
translated: but never his faults.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad smad pa yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad smad pa yis //
translated: By disparaging all the buddhas,

original: des ni rtag tu sdug bsngal thob //🔽tsha dang sbyar dug dug nad dang mkha' 'gro'i chom rkun bgegs rnams kyis //
analyzed: des ni rtag tu sdug bsngal thob // tsha dang sbyar dug dug nad dang mkha' 'gro'i chom rkun bgegs rnams kyis //
translated: he will always obtain suffering.🔽By the poison of fire, poison, disease, and the thieves of the dakinis,

original: gdon dang log 'dren rnams kyis kyang //
analyzed: gdon dang log 'dren rnams kyis kyang //
translated: by the spirits and the maras,

original: bsad nas dmyal bar ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bsad nas dmyal bar ltung ba'o //
translated: having killed, one falls into hell.🔽Thus, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon smod pa rnams la 'bras bu ngan pa bstan pa ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon smod pa rnams la 'bras bu ngan pa bstan pa ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the result of disparaging the master, which is the proof.

original: yang na slob dpon ni rdo rje 'chang chen po 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: yang na slob dpon ni rdo rje 'chang chen po 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Or else, the master is the Great Vajradhara, the clear light.

original: de thob nas glo bur du byung ba'i nga rgyal gyi skyon gyis de nyid spangs te /
analyzed: de thob nas glo bur du byung ba'i nga rgyal gyi skyon gyis de nyid spangs te /
translated: Having attained that, through the fault of the pride that has arisen, one abandons that very [state].

original: gang zhig zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas gnas pa de ni /
translated: One who, by means of the stage of generation beginning with the moon and vajra, abides in that [state],

original: snying nas slob dpon smod pa dag / ces pa ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams te /
analyzed: snying nas slob dpon smod pa dag / ces pa ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams te /
translated: is one who from the heart disparages the master, who is a conceptual yogin.

original: de dag 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not succeed in attaining the state of clear light,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid du dus zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid du dus zad pa'i phyir ro //
