translated: the one who is wise, the yogī who is not contemptuous, if he practices, then at that time he becomes Great Vajradhara, is the remainder of the verse.

original: de ni sgrub pa dang de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa dang spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa dang de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa dang spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
translated: That is the practice, the worship of reality, and the practice without elaboration.

original: yang na go ku da ha na'i sha lnga dang / dbang po'i dri ma ste zla ba drug go //
analyzed: yang na go ku da ha na'i sha lnga dang / dbang po'i dri ma ste zla ba drug go //
translated: Or else, the five meats of cow, dog, elephant, horse, and human, and the six sense objects, are the six months.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
translated: The Tathāgatas who are the nature of form, sound, smell, taste, and so forth,

original: gang zhig shes rab can gyi rim pas bsgom pa ni gtor ma phul na de'i tshe rnal 'byor ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab can gyi rim pas bsgom pa ni gtor ma phul na de'i tshe rnal 'byor ba de ni /
translated: the one who is wise, who meditates on them by the process of wisdom, if he offers a bali, then at that time that yogī

original: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: becomes Great Vajradhara, just as before.

original: de ni sgrub pa dang mchod pa chen po dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa dang mchod pa chen po dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
translated: That is the great practice and worship, and the extremely unelaborate conduct.🔽In order to explain just this,

original: 'di nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: he declares,

original: gsang ba de nyid mchod chen gyis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang ba de nyid mchod chen gyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsungs te /
translated: “By the secret, that reality worship,🔽and the great worship,🔽one should worship with the three kinds of worship and meditate.

original: mchod pa de dag rnam pa gsum gyis mchod pa byas la bsgom par bya ba ni khyad par du rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur te sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa de dag rnam pa gsum gyis mchod pa byas la bsgom par bya ba ni khyad par du rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur te sgrub pa'o //
translated: The special attainment is the attainment of Great Vajradhara itself.

original: de kho na nyid dang gsang ba'i mchod pa dang mchod pa chen po dag rgya che bar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang gsang ba'i mchod pa dang mchod pa chen po dag rgya che bar bshad par bya ste /
translated: The secret worship, the reality worship, and the great worship should be explained in detail.

original: bshang gci zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bshang gci zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Excrement, urine,” and so on.

original: bshang gci dag nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir rdzas lnga ste /
analyzed: bshang gci dag nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir rdzas lnga ste /
translated: The five substances are illustrated by excrement and urine.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab par byas la /🔽'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'dod pas /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab par byas la /🔽'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'dod pas /
translated: Having consecrated them with mantra and seal,🔽one should worship with the three kinds of worship,🔽and meditate on the deity.🔽One should worship with the three kinds of worship and meditate.

original: khyad par gyi zhag la brten cing gal te spyod na de'i tshe de la bla med de de kho na nyid ni gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i yid /
analyzed: khyad par gyi zhag la brten cing gal te spyod na de'i tshe de la bla med de de kho na nyid ni gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i yid /
translated: If one practices in dependence on the special days, then at that time, the unsurpassed reality is the mind free from the aspects of purity, etc.

original: de bzhin du byang chub ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / skyon med pa ni ye shes kyi sku 'grub par 'gyur te sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / skyon med pa ni ye shes kyi sku 'grub par 'gyur te sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: Likewise, enlightenment is nonconceptual intuition, and the faultless is the intuition body that is accomplished, i.e., attained.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de dus @101a * //
analyzed: de dus @101a * //
translated: At that time

original: brtsams te de ni rtog pa med //
analyzed: brtsams te de ni rtog pa med //
translated: one begins, and that is nonconceptual.

original: de mchog dbyibs dang phyag mtshan ci 'dod pa //
analyzed: de mchog dbyibs dang phyag mtshan ci 'dod pa //
translated: The supreme, with whatever shape and insignia one desires,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //🔽sdom pa de las bya ba byas pa bsgom //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku // sdom pa de las bya ba byas pa bsgom //
translated: is the inconceivable body of evolution.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One meditates on the vow, having done what is to be done.

original: yang bshang gci la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: yang bshang gci la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: Again, the five heaps of feces, urine, etc.

original: de dag zos pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal bar zhugs pa gang yin pa de rnams zas su bshang gci za ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag zos pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim gyis 'od gsal bar zhugs pa gang yin pa de rnams zas su bshang gci za ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: are the food of those who eat feces and urine, i.e., the yogis of the perfection stage, who, by the process of purifying the mind, enter into clear light.

original: 'bras bu 'od gsal ba don du gnyer bas na 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'od gsal ba don du gnyer bas na 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since one is desirous of the result because of striving for the clear light result, one is desirous of the result.

original: yang dag bla med ni sems dang sems las byung ba spong bas mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bla med ni sems dang sems las byung ba spong bas mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The true unsurpassed is the supreme because of the abandonment of mind and mental factors.

original: byang chub ni 'od gsal dri ma med pas na skyon med pa de dang 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor pa la 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub ni 'od gsal dri ma med pas na skyon med pa de dang 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor pa la 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The enlightenment is the faultless clear light, and the accomplishment is the attainment of the yoga that is similar to that.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the purification of mind and the worship of reality.

original: zas su sha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa chen po bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zas su sha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa chen po bstan par bya ste /
translated: The great worship is taught by food is the flesh, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa'i don du gsal te lha bshos phul na de'i tshe sha dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa'i don du gsal te lha bshos phul na de'i tshe sha dbul bar bya'o //
translated: When one offers a sacrificial cake for the sake of worshiping the mandala circle, at that time one should offer flesh.

original: rigs thams cad kyi yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it of all types? No, it is not.

original: sha chen zhes bya ba ni kha na ma thob med pa mi ro'i lus las byung ba de dang 'dra ba rab brtags pa ni dbul ba dang spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: sha chen zhes bya ba ni kha na ma thob med pa mi ro'i lus las byung ba de dang 'dra ba rab brtags pa ni dbul ba dang spyod par bya'o //
translated: The great flesh is the flesh of a human corpse that is free of sin. One should offer and enjoy that which is similar to that, or that which is imagined to be like that.

original: 'dir man ngag ni skye ba bdun pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am //🔽lcebs nas shi ba'i skyes pa'i rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni skye ba bdun pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am // lcebs nas shi ba'i skyes pa'i rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas /
translated: Here, the esoteric instruction is that one should take the great flesh of a person who has the characteristics of a seven-times-born person,🔽or the vajra of a man who has died by hanging,

original: mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba blangs te /
analyzed: mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba blangs te /
translated: and having taken it with the procedure taught in the Nectar-Vajra Tantra,

original: de nyid kyi lag par mtshon cha sbyin zhing des byin pa lus kyi dum bu byin pa gang yin pa de ni sha chen te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi lag par mtshon cha sbyin zhing des byin pa lus kyi dum bu byin pa gang yin pa de ni sha chen te /
translated: one should give the weapon to his hand, and whatever pieces of his body are given by him, that is the great flesh.🔽If one offers it to the gods, they will grant spiritual powers.

original: lha rnams la phul na dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: lha rnams la phul na dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said by the wise.

original: de ltar byas nas sku gsung thugs ni sku la sogs pa gsum ma ma /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas sku gsung thugs ni sku la sogs pa gsum ma ma /
translated: Having done that, the body, speech, and mind are the three, body and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams rtsol ba med pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams rtsol ba med pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accomplishment of the five families of transcendent lords is the effortless accomplishment of the spiritual powers of the wheel holder and so forth.

original: gsang ba ni ro langs pa'i cho ga yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang ba ni ro langs pa'i cho ga yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The secret is the accomplishment of the zombie procedure.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dngos grub thams cad ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus su shes pa'i dngos grub rnams @101b ster ba ste /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus su shes pa'i dngos grub rnams @101b ster ba ste /
translated: All powers are the bestowal of the powers of knowledge of the past, future, and present.

original: dngos grub thams cad ster ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ster ba'o //
translated: He bestows all powers.

original: de ni sgrub pa dang mchod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa dang mchod pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great accomplishment and worship.

original: yang na sha ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sha ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: Or else, flesh is the three consciousnesses.

original: de rnams bza' ba ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams bza' ba ni snang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: To eat them is to make them invisible by the process of appearance, etc.

original: sha chen ni de nyid 'od gsal bar brtags par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sha chen ni de nyid 'od gsal bar brtags par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Great flesh is the imagination of that very [consciousness] as clearlight.

original: de ltar byas nas sku gsung thugs 'grub par 'gyur ba ni lus ngag yid bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin rnams bkag pas so //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas sku gsung thugs 'grub par 'gyur ba ni lus ngag yid bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin rnams bkag pas so //
translated: Having done that, the accomplishment of body, speech, and mind is the cause of the generation of body, speech, and mind, because it stops the natures.

original: gsal ba ni thams cad stong pa'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba ni thams cad stong pa'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: Clear is the state of the emptiness of everything.

original: dngos grub thams cad ster ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur zhes ston to //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ster ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur zhes ston to //
translated: The bestowal of all powers is the bestowal of the supramundane powers of the strengths, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is the pure mind.

original: sha'i skabs su gzhan yang bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sha'i skabs su gzhan yang bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to explain the flesh,

original: glang po'i sha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: glang po'i sha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares “the flesh of elephants,” and so on.

original: glang po che la sogs pa gsum ni 'jig rten las 'gal ba'i srog chags so //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa gsum ni 'jig rten las 'gal ba'i srog chags so //
translated: The three, elephants and so on, are living beings that are contrary to the world.

original: de bzhin gyi sgras ni ba lang yang stobs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gyi sgras ni ba lang yang stobs so //
translated: The word “also” includes cows.

original: dam pa ni skyes pa'i'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni skyes pa'i'o //
translated: “The best” means the male.

original: srog chags de rnams kyi sha blangs te /
analyzed: srog chags de rnams kyi sha blangs te /
translated: Having taken the flesh of those living beings,

original: aom tr'am hr'i:h'um kham zhes bya ba'i sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la phul zhing de nas bdag nyid kyis bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom tr'am hr'i:h'um kham zhes bya ba'i sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la phul zhing de nas bdag nyid kyis bza' bar bya'o //
translated: one should consecrate it with the seed syllables Oṃ, Traṃ, Hrīḥ, Haṃ, and Khaṃ, and offer it to the kings of wrath. Then one should eat it oneself.

original: zas kyi phyir zas gzhan ma rnams zhes pa ni de ma yin pa'i zas bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: zas kyi phyir zas gzhan ma rnams zhes pa ni de ma yin pa'i zas bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: “Not other foods for the sake of food” means one should not eat other foods.

original: zhi ba'i zas ni khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor la dgos pa ma yin te sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i zas ni khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor la dgos pa ma yin te sgrub pa'o //
translated: The food of peace is not necessary for the maṇḍala of the kings of wrath.

original: yang na glang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na glang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Or, the elephant is the visual consciousness.

original: gzugs glang po mo'i reg pas phyi rol du chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs glang po mo'i reg pas phyi rol du chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form is the cow elephant, because of attachment to external objects.

original: rta ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ste ;
analyzed: rta ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ste ;
translated: The horse is the ear consciousness,

original: sgra'i rtsva la sogs pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i rtsva la sogs pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of attachment to the grass of sound, and so on.

original: khyi ni sna'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: khyi ni sna'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The dog is the nose consciousness,

original: dri'i zas la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri'i zas la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of attachment to the food of smell.

original: ba lang ni lce'i rnam par shes pa ste ro'i gnas la rtag tu chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang ni lce'i rnam par shes pa ste ro'i gnas la rtag tu chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bull is the tongue consciousness, because of constant attachment to the abode of taste.

original: skyes pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa ste reg bya med pas shi ba 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa ste reg bya med pas shi ba 'dod phyir ro //
translated: The man is the body consciousness, because of attachment to the dead body, which is without tactile sensation.

original: de rnams kyi sha ni yul lnga ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sha ni yul lnga ste /
translated: Their flesh is the five objects.

original: de rnams bcu bza' bar bya ba ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag gis 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams bcu bza' bar bya ba ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag gis 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should eat those ten, that is, enter the state of utter lucidity by means of the stages of manifest enlightenment, the meditative absorptions of totalities and overmasteries.

original: zas gzhan dag ni ma zos na zhes bya ba la mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa @102a * //
analyzed: zas gzhan dag ni ma zos na zhes bya ba la mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa @102a * //
translated: As for the other foods, if one does not eat them, one will die.

original: la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas zas ni kham gyi za ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis za bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas zas ni kham gyi za ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis za bar mi bya ste /
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in that should not eat with the characteristics of eating morsels.

original: bsam gtan za ba can gyi rnal 'byor pas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: bsam gtan za ba can gyi rnal 'byor pas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: The yogi/nī who eats meditative concentration will abide.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: mchod pa rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The result of the three kinds of offerings should be taught.

original: mnyes par gyur pa ni de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mnyes par gyur pa ni de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The buddhas, the tathāgatas, are pleased by such a yogi/nī.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are Kṣitigarbha and so on.

original: de nyid kyi blo ni shes rab ma rnams te de rnams gang la gang la yod pa de ni blo can te rigs mthun pa nyid kyis khro bo'i rgyal po rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi blo ni shes rab ma rnams te de rnams gang la gang la yod pa de ni blo can te rigs mthun pa nyid kyis khro bo'i rgyal po rnams so //
translated: Their minds are the prajñās, and those who have them are the “intelligent ones,” the wrathful kings, by virtue of their similar type.

original: de rnams yang mnyes par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams yang mnyes par gyur pa ste /
translated: They are also pleased.

original: dkyil 'khor pa ma lus pa mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa ma lus pa mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: All the members of the maṇḍala are pleased, it is taught.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi mchod pa'i rim pas myur du ni yun ring pa ma yin par sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi mchod pa'i rim pas myur du ni yun ring pa ma yin par sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by the process of worship with these three aspects, one quickly attains buddhahood, not after a long time,

original: thabs mang ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mang ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: because there are many methods.

original: de bzhin du 'dod khams ni gnas nyi shu ste de la dbang phyug ni gtso bo ste mchod pa'i rim pas byin la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod khams ni gnas nyi shu ste de la dbang phyug ni gtso bo ste mchod pa'i rim pas byin la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the desire realm is the twenty abodes. The lord is the principal one, because he controls giving, etc.

original: go 'phang ni bsam gtan gtso bor gyur pa'i gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: go 'phang ni bsam gtan gtso bor gyur pa'i gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The state is the form realm, which is principally the meditative absorptions.

original: las ni las kyi bag chags yod pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: las ni las kyi bag chags yod pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: Action is the formless realm, because the latent potentialities of action exist there.

original: de dag byed pa ni bdag po nyid du gnas te go 'phang las ni byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag byed pa ni bdag po nyid du gnas te go 'phang las ni byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They abide as the lords of those, and action arises from the state.

original: de bzhin du gzi ni mngon par shes pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzi ni mngon par shes pa lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, the brilliant is the five superknowledges.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni gzi can no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni gzi can no //
translated: One who has them is brilliant.

original: stobs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs te gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: stobs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs te gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: Power is the power of the Tathagata, the ten powers such as the knowledge of the possible and the impossible.

original: de rnams yod pas na stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yod pas na stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since he has them, he is powerful.

original: gtso bo mi 'jigs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gtso bo mi 'jigs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The principal ones are the four confidences.

original: mdangs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdangs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Splendor is the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: de rnams bzang po gang la yod pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams bzang po gang la yod pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: Since he has them, he is splendid.

original: mthong na yid du 'ong ba ni dpe rnams te /
analyzed: mthong na yid du 'ong ba ni dpe rnams te /
translated: Delightful to behold are the examples.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Since he has them, he is delightful.

original: 'jig rten 'di dag dbang du gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag dbang du gyur //
translated: He has power over these worlds.

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i gling bzhi pa dang mtho ris la gnas pa'i lha la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa ni bstan pa'i sgo nas dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i gling bzhi pa dang mtho ris la gnas pa'i lha la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa ni bstan pa'i sgo nas dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: Since he has power over the four continents and the gods of the desire realm, he has power over the world.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis @102b zhes pa ni gzugs mthong ba tsam gyis kyang dbang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis @102b zhes pa ni gzugs mthong ba tsam gyis kyang dbang du byed pa ste /
translated: By mere sight, he has power over the world by merely being seen.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The yogin has such characteristics.

original: bskul ba ni gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi lha mo gzhan ma rnams kyis gnod par gyur na de rnams dbang du bya ba la smos ci dgos zhes ston to //
analyzed: bskul ba ni gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi lha mo gzhan ma rnams kyis gnod par gyur na de rnams dbang du bya ba la smos ci dgos zhes ston to //
translated: The exhortation is: if even the other worldly goddesses are harmed, what need is there to speak of bringing them under one's control?

original: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The summary is to be explained:

original: 'di ni sngar bshad pa'i mchod pa rnam gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bshad pa'i mchod pa rnam gsum gyi mtshan nyid dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa ste /
translated: This is the characteristic of the three previously explained offerings, and the meditation on the subtle yoga.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni gnyi ga'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gsang ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni gnyi ga'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gsang ba ni /
translated: The secret of all the Buddhas,

original: rtag tu bsgom par byas pa dang / sbas par byas nas byang chub dam pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub ster par byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu bsgom par byas pa dang / sbas par byas nas byang chub dam pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub ster par byed do //
translated: the yogins of both kinds, is the bestowal of the supreme enlightenment, the Great Vajradhara's spiritual power, when it is always meditated upon and performed in secret.

original: 'di las yang sngon du sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di las yang sngon du sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ste /
translated: Here again, the mantra is the three Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi gsang ba ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sa bon gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsang ba ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sa bon gsum mo //
translated: Their secret is the three seed syllables of the consecration of body, speech, and mind.

original: yang dag pa ni rjes su dran par byed pa'i sngags rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni rjes su dran par byed pa'i sngags rnam gsum mo //
translated: The true is the three kinds of mantras that bring to mind.

original: yang ji ltar bya zhe na tha mal pa'i lus ngag sems lta ba ni sbyar bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bya zhe na tha mal pa'i lus ngag sems lta ba ni sbyar bar byed pa ste /
translated: How is it done? By applying the ordinary body, speech, and mind.

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: [It is done] by the generation and perfection stages.🔽The consecration of body, speech, and mind is the placement of the seed syllables and the recitation of the mantras.

original: sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa ni yig 'bru'i sngags dgod pa dang / klog pa dag gis rnam par dag pa le'u gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa ni yig 'bru'i sngags dgod pa dang / klog pa dag gis rnam par dag pa le'u gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The chapter in which these are present is called by that name.

original: rgyud 'grel las le'u drug pa'i tshig gis don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'grel las le'u drug pa'i tshig gis don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o //
translated: The commentary on the Tantra explains the meaning of the six chapters.

original: le'u drug pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga'o /
analyzed: le'u drug pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga'o /
translated: The number of verses in the sixth chapter is two hundred and seventy-five.

original: // / da ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor pa las le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i spyod pa spros pas yang spyod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor pa las le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i spyod pa spros pas yang spyod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the practitioner who has consecrated body, speech, and mind should again practice the conduct taught in the fifth chapter, with the elaboration of conduct.

original: de'i phyir le'u bdun pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir le'u bdun pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the seventh chapter,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Then,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi bdag ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi bdag ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Lord of the Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathagatas is Great Vajradhara.

original: dam tshig chen po ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The Great Commitment is the elaborate practice.

original: de kho na nyid ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Reality is the unelaborate practice.

original: sngags ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas te /
analyzed: sngags ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas te /
translated: The Mantra is the very unelaborate practice.

original: spyod pa de rnams kyis thob pa gang zhig mngon par byang chub pa ni chos 'byung ba dang chos kyi dbyings dang / bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: spyod pa de rnams kyis thob pa gang zhig mngon par byang chub pa ni chos 'byung ba dang chos kyi dbyings dang / bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa ste gsum mo //
translated: The three kinds of manifest enlightenment are the attainment by means of those practices: the enlightenment of the source of phenomena, the enlightenment of the realm of phenomena, and the unexcelled manifest enlightenment.

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni le'u ste /🔽de @103a * //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni le'u ste / de @103a * //
translated: A collection of texts that is preeminent is a chapter.

original: nyid gsungs ni bka' stsal ba ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nyid gsungs ni bka' stsal ba ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is taught, is spoken, is accomplished.

original: de rnams nyid dang po bshad par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
analyzed: de rnams nyid dang po bshad par bya ba'i phyir / 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
translated: In order to explain just those,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “All the enjoyments of desire,” and so on.

original: 'dod pa thams cad ni phyi'i phyag rgya ma ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ni phyi'i phyag rgya ma ste /
translated: All desires are the external consort.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lnga'o //
translated: The five natures are Rupavajrā, and so on.

original: de dag mdor bsdus pa'i zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bskyed cing sa bon lngas spyi bo la sogs par byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de dag mdor bsdus pa'i zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bskyed cing sa bon lngas spyi bo la sogs par byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Those are generated in the sequence of the moon and vajra, and so on, in brief, and are empowered on the crown, and so on, with the five seed syllables.

original: sngar bshad pa'i khang pa sum brtsegs la sogs pas gnas pa ste rang gis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal byas la /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i khang pa sum brtsegs la sogs pas gnas pa ste rang gis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal byas la /
translated: One should abide in the three-storied house, and so on, as previously explained, and with the pride of being Great Vajradhara.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te de rnams longs spyod ni de'i tshe ji ltar 'dod pa ni ji ltar sems dga' bar byas nas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gal te de rnams longs spyod ni de'i tshe ji ltar 'dod pa ni ji ltar sems dga' bar byas nas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one enjoys those, then, as one wishes, one will attain buddhahood, having delighted the mind.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Some desire a maiden,🔽some desire a mature woman,

original: la la gzhon nu mar 'dod dang // la la dar la bab 'dod dang // gzhan mas rag pa gang yang rung //
analyzed: la la gzhon nu mar 'dod dang // la la dar la bab 'dod dang // gzhan mas rag pa gang yang rung //
translated: and some desire a woman of any age.

original: phra ba ljang gu gzhan mas 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phra ba ljang gu gzhan mas 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Some desire a slender, green woman.

original: yang na mdog dkar po la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi lha gang yang rung ba'i bsgom pa la chags pa dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma rnams longs spyod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mdog dkar po la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi lha gang yang rung ba'i bsgom pa la chags pa dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma rnams longs spyod par bya ste /
translated: or any deity of the family of Vairocana, etc., or the pledge seal women.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sgra'i don to ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sgra'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of the words is as desired.

original: / de ltar de rnams bsten na sbyor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rol pa'i tshogs kyi sbyor bas myur du ni bde bas so //
analyzed: / de ltar de rnams bsten na sbyor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rol pa'i tshogs kyi sbyor bas myur du ni bde bas so //
translated: Thus, by relying on them, the yoga is the yoga of the assembly of the play of passion, etc., by which one quickly attains buddhahood, by bliss.

original: sangs rgyas ni chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob par gyur pa ni rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob par gyur pa ni rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Attaining manifest enlightenment in the phenomena source, one attains buddhahood.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa dag go //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa dag go //
translated: This is the elaborate mode of conduct, the stage of development and practice.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The unelaborate mode of conduct should be explained.

original: 'dod pa thams cad ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
translated: All desires are the five objects, such as the form of the goddess.

original: de rnams ji ltar 'dod pa ni ji snyed pas lus 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir bsten pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar 'dod pa ni ji snyed pas lus 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir bsten pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of those is the enjoyment of whatever one desires, in order to sustain the body.

original: de dag bsten pa ni rang gi lha ste /
analyzed: de dag bsten pa ni rang gi lha ste /
translated: The enjoyment of those is one's deity,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa las gang yang rung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa las gang yang rung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: any one of the Tathagatas, Vajrasattva, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni de nyid shing la sogs pas phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de nyid shing la sogs pas phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is the application of the hand, face, etc. to that very tree, etc.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi lung du bstan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma ste de @103b dag mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid rang gi bdag nyid dang / gzhan gyi lung du bstan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma ste de @103b dag mchod par bya'o //
translated: The worship is the worship of oneself and the pledge seal woman, who is taught to be one's own self and another, by the yogin who is characterized by that.

original: de yang de bzhin du byas la nags la slong mo slong zhing nags tshal gyi lha mo rnams las kha zas rnyed cing lus 'tsho bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du byas la nags la slong mo slong zhing nags tshal gyi lha mo rnams las kha zas rnyed cing lus 'tsho bar bya ba ste /
translated: And that is done in that way, begging for alms in the forest, and finding food from the forest goddesses, in order to sustain the body.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa rnams so //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang bsgrub pa rnams so //
translated: The conduct is the conduct without elaboration, and the creation stage and the accomplishments.

original: spyod pa gnyi ga la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la mi bzad pa'i spyod pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod pa gnyi ga la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la mi bzad pa'i spyod pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the yogis who engage in both the conduct of the perfection vehicle and the conduct of the mantra vehicle, in order to prohibit unbearable conduct,

original: dka' thub sdom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dka' thub sdom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Asceticism, vows, and so on, are not the means to quickly attain buddhahood.”

original: dka' thub ni lus ngal bar byed pa'i nyan thos pa rnams kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dka' thub ni lus ngal bar byed pa'i nyan thos pa rnams kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis so //
translated: Asceticism is the twelve ascetic practices of the śrāvakas, which exhaust the body.

original: sdom pa ni lan gsum du gos brje ba dang / lan gsum du khrus dang nye reg la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ni lan gsum du gos brje ba dang / lan gsum du khrus dang nye reg la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vows are the three changes of clothing, the three ablutions and ablutions with a wet cloth, and so on.

original: bya ba'i rgyud kyi sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud kyi sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are for the mantra practitioners of action tantra.

original: mi bzad pa ni lus kyi phyag rgya dang / g-yas brkyang pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni lus kyi phyag rgya dang / g-yas brkyang pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Unbearable is the body’s mudrā, the right leg extended, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are for the mantra practitioners of yoga tantra.

original: de dag brten na yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ni myur du dang phyin ci ma log par sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag brten na yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ni myur du dang phyin ci ma log par sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Even if one relies on them, one will not attain buddhahood quickly and without error.

original: la la na re mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i zla ba spyod pa la sogs pa dka' thub la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: la la na re mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i zla ba spyod pa la sogs pa dka' thub la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bshad pa yin la /
translated: Some say that the words “austerity” and so on refer to the practices of the tīrthikas and so on.

original: de ni mi rigs te nyan thos la sogs pas kyang de rnams spang bya yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te nyan thos la sogs pas kyang de rnams spang bya yin te /
translated: But that is not correct, because the śrāvakas and so on also reject those.

original: sngags pa rnams kyis smos ci dgos so //
analyzed: sngags pa rnams kyis smos ci dgos so //
translated: So what need is there to mention the mantrāyāna?

original: de bas na tha mal pa'i theg pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub la sogs pa 'dir bkag par rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na tha mal pa'i theg pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub la sogs pa 'dir bkag par rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to reject the austerities of the ordinary vehicle and so on here.

original: rgyal po'i rin chen phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rin chen phreng ba las kyang /
translated: The Rājaparikathāratnamālā says:

original: lus ni gcig pu ngal ba yis //
analyzed: lus ni gcig pu ngal ba yis //
translated: The body is exhausted by austerities,

original: gang phyir chos dag de las med //
analyzed: gang phyir chos dag de las med //
translated: but the Dharma is not found in that.🔽It is not free from the harm of others,

original: gzhan gyi 'tshe ba bral min dang // gzhan rnams la ni phan pa med //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'tshe ba bral min dang // gzhan rnams la ni phan pa med //
translated: and it does not benefit others.

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pas gsal //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pas gsal //
translated: It is illuminated by generosity, discipline, and patience.

original: gang gis bstan bcos lam po che //🔽spangs te lus kyi ngal ba yi //
analyzed: gang gis bstan bcos lam po che // spangs te lus kyi ngal ba yi //
translated: By whom is the great path of the treatises🔽abandoned, and the bad path of the forest

original: dgon pa'i lam ngan las 'gro ba /🔽de ni / srid pa'i dgon pa mi bzod pa //
analyzed: dgon pa'i lam ngan las 'gro ba / de ni / srid pa'i dgon pa mi bzod pa //
translated: of the body’s exhaustion taken?🔽That is the unbearable forest of existence,

original: mtha' yas skye bo shing drung can ;
analyzed: mtha' yas skye bo shing drung can ;
translated: with its infinite beings and trees.

original: / nyon mongs sprul cing des lus khyab / shin tu ring bar zhugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: / nyon mongs sprul cing des lus khyab / shin tu ring bar zhugs par 'gyur //
translated: The afflictions spread out like snakes, and they enter very deeply.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it accomplished?

original: sngar bshad pa'i 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod pa la brten nas myur du 'grub par 'gyur te /🔽bde ba dang ldan pas sems mnyam @104a * //🔽par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod pa la brten nas myur du 'grub par 'gyur te / bde ba dang ldan pas sems mnyam @104a * // par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is quickly accomplished by relying on the enjoyment of all desires explained above.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “The mind becomes concentrated through the possession of bliss.”

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: Thus, the worldly and transcendent Vajra Tantra also says,

original: bde bas byang chub thob pa yi //
analyzed: bde bas byang chub thob pa yi //
translated: “Awakening is attained through bliss.

original: lus gdungs pas ni byang chub min //
analyzed: lus gdungs pas ni byang chub min //
translated: Awakening is not through the torment of the body.

original: gang phyir blo ni bde ba yis //
analyzed: gang phyir blo ni bde ba yis //
translated: Because the mind is blissful,

original: ting nge 'dzin las sangs rgyas 'byung //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las sangs rgyas 'byung //
translated: the Buddha arises from meditative concentration.

original: mi za ba la sogs dka' thub kyis //
analyzed: mi za ba la sogs dka' thub kyis //
translated: Through austerities such as fasting,🔽the body is tormented, and likewise others,

original: lus gdung de bzhin gzhan rnams dang // lus ngal dang ni nyon mongs pas //
analyzed: lus gdung de bzhin gzhan rnams dang // lus ngal dang ni nyon mongs pas //
translated: and through the fatigue of the body and the afflictions,

original: rnam par g-yeng bas 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bas 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: there is no accomplishment through distraction.”

original: dman pa'i sems can grub min te //
analyzed: dman pa'i sems can grub min te //
translated: Not for the inferior sentient being.

original: des ni mi zad rab tu brtan //
analyzed: des ni mi zad rab tu brtan //
translated: By that, one becomes firm and imperishable.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du dpal mchog dang po las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal mchog dang po las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Sri-Paramadya declares:

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
translated: I am all the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras nyid de bzhin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras nyid de bzhin //
translated: and also the sons of the Buddhas.

original: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of one's own deity,

original: de phyir bdag nyid bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de phyir bdag nyid bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should therefore accomplish oneself.

original: dka' thub sdom pa mi zad pas //
analyzed: dka' thub sdom pa mi zad pas //
translated: By the imperishable vow of austerity,

original: lus ni sdug bsngal ldan bskams 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni sdug bsngal ldan bskams 'gyur //
translated: the body becomes dried out and full of pain.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs pas //
translated: By pain, the mind is distracted;

original: g-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
translated: by distraction, one does not attain success.

original: yid dang lus dag brtan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yid dang lus dag brtan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to stabilize the mind and body,

original: rang gi bde bas brtan par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi bde bas brtan par 'gyur //
translated: one becomes firm by one's own happiness.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni g-yo 'gyur dang // 'gal ba yang ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni g-yo 'gyur dang // 'gal ba yang ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: By pain, one becomes unstable and also attains opposition.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'o na phyi rol gyi yul rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pas 'on kyang ngan 'gror skul bar byed pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na phyi rol gyi yul rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pas 'on kyang ngan 'gror skul bar byed pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be the cause of being summoned to miserable realms.🔽How can they be the cause of enlightenment?🔽Those confused by incorrect knowledge, like the insane, say this.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu ji ltar yin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin pa'i rmongs pa rnams kyis smyon pa la sogs pa bzhin du tshig 'di yin no zhe na de skad ma zer cig / thabs kyi khyad par gyis yul de rnams longs spyod na
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu ji ltar yin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin pa'i rmongs pa rnams kyis smyon pa la sogs pa bzhin du tshig 'di yin no zhe na de skad ma zer cig / thabs kyi khyad par gyis yul de rnams longs spyod na
translated: But if one enjoys those objects through the special method,

original: byang chub kyi rgyu yin te phyin ci log pas bsten na dmyal ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu yin te phyin ci log pas bsten na dmyal ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: they are the cause of enlightenment. If one relies on them incorrectly, they are the cause of hell.

original: dper na ke ta ka'i me tog spos kyi glang pos zos na gla rtsi bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na ke ta ka'i me tog spos kyi glang pos zos na gla rtsi bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if the elephant of incense eats the ketaka flower, it becomes musk.

original: tha mal pa'i grang po gzhan mas zos na de nyid mi gtsang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i grang po gzhan mas zos na de nyid mi gtsang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If another ordinary elephant eats it, it becomes feces.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dag pa'i rgyud la gnas pas 'bras bu khyad par can byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dag pa'i rgyud la gnas pas 'bras bu khyad par can byed pa ste /
translated: Similarly, attachment and so on, when residing in a pure continuum, create a special result.

original: bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: by reason of the difference of the intention.

original: gzhan yang dper na sprul la sogs pas 'o ma 'thungs na dug la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na sprul la sogs pas 'o ma 'thungs na dug la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, for example, when a snake drinks milk, it becomes more poisonous.

original: mi @104b gzhan ma rnams kyis 'thungs na de nyid bdud rtsi la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi @104b gzhan ma rnams kyis 'thungs na de nyid bdud rtsi la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When other animals drink it, it becomes nectar.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams ni bsdam pa khyad par dang ldan pa la khyad par gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams ni bsdam pa khyad par dang ldan pa la khyad par gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste /
translated: In the same way, these attachments, etc. give forth a special effect when they are in a special stream.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not naturally sinful.

original: 'dir ni sbyor ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyor ba 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the argument:

original: gang dang gang khyad par gyi rgyud la gnas pa de dang de khyad par gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang khyad par gyi rgyud la gnas pa de dang de khyad par gyi 'bras bu ster ba ste /
translated: Whatever is in a special stream gives forth a special effect,

original: dper na ke ta ka la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ke ta ka la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the ketaka gem, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs la sogs pa yang khyad par gyi rgyud la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs la sogs pa yang khyad par gyi rgyud la gnas pa ste /
translated: And attachment, etc. are in a special stream.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural reason.

original: 'dir ni khyad par gyi rgyud la dgos pa'i yongs su gyur pa tsam gyi 'grel pa dang ldan pas khyad par gyi 'bras bu byed pa thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa rgyu'i tshogs kyis skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par gyi rgyud la dgos pa'i yongs su gyur pa tsam gyi 'grel pa dang ldan pas khyad par gyi 'bras bu byed pa thogs pa med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa rgyu'i tshogs kyis skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Here, however, the special transformation is merely the cause of the special effect, and it is produced by the collection of causes that have the capacity to produce the effect without obstruction.

original: gang gi rang bzhin de tsam gyis 'brel pa dang ldan pa de ni des byed pa yin te thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin de tsam gyis 'brel pa dang ldan pa de ni des byed pa yin te thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has a nature that is related to just that is produced by it, because it is without obstruction.

original: med na yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, one would not be convinced.

original: de bas na khyad par gyi yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par gyi yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the special transformation does not depend on another,

original: de tsam gyi 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: de tsam gyi 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: because the relation to just that is shown.

original: de la yang thogs pa med pa ste ltos pa mad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang thogs pa med pa ste ltos pa mad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is without obstruction, because there is no dependence.

original: ltos pa med pa ni rtogs par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa ni rtogs par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is without dependence, because there is no other object to be understood.

original: de bas na de tsam gyis 'brel pa'i nges pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de tsam gyis 'brel pa'i nges pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the relation to just that is ascertained, and the natural reason is shown.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rnal 'byor pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin te rab tu sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rnal 'byor pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin te rab tu sgrub pa'o //
translated: By this very reasoning, attachment and so on are also the cause of the yogin's enlightenment, because they are well established.

original: don yod grub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: And in the Amoghasiddhi Tantra it is said:

original: rmongs pa gang gis bcings 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rmongs pa gang gis bcings 'gyur ba //
translated: By whatever delusion one is bound,

original: mkhas pa nyid kyis grol 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mkhas pa nyid kyis grol 'gyur ba //
translated: By that very thing the wise are freed.

original: de ltar byang chub bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub bsgom pa yis //
translated: Thus, by cultivating enlightenment,

original: thams cad byin ci log 'di yin //🔽lcags kyi gong bu chur bskur na //🔽'ba' zhig tu ni nub par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad byin ci log 'di yin // lcags kyi gong bu chur bskur na // 'ba' zhig tu ni nub par 'gyur //
translated: All is the reversal of error.🔽When a lump of iron is put in the fire,🔽It melts down to a liquid.

original: snod du byas pa de nyid ni //🔽gzhan bsgral ba dang rang brgal ba'o //
analyzed: snod du byas pa de nyid ni // gzhan bsgral ba dang rang brgal ba'o //
translated: When it is put in water,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It becomes hard again.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the conduct of the extremely unelaborate mode should be explained.

original: slong mo za zhing mi bzla ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: slong mo za zhing mi bzla ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One should not recite while eating alms.

original: slong mo ni phyi rol gyi kham gyi za ba ste /
analyzed: slong mo ni phyi rol gyi kham gyi za ba ste /
translated: Alms is the outer, material food.

original: de nyid gang gis bza' bar byed pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gang gis bza' bar byed pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
translated: One who eats that is an alms eater.

original: phyi rol gyi zas zab de lta bu'i rnal 'byor bas mi bzla ste zhes pa ni bsgom @105a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zas zab de lta bu'i rnal 'byor bas mi bzla ste zhes pa ni bsgom @105a * //
translated: Such a yogi does not eat such deep food externally.🔽

original: par mi bya ste /
analyzed: par mi bya ste /
translated: The yogi should not eat such deep food means that one should not meditate.

original: 'on kyang bsam gtan gyi bza' bas 'tsho bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam gtan gyi bza' bas 'tsho bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: It shows that one should live by the food of concentration.

original: slong la dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: slong la dga' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not delight in begging.

original: zhes pa ni bsad nams kyi tshogs 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu dad pas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du gal te gzhan ma rnams 'byor pa la bza' ba byin na de spang bar mi bya ste 'on kyang de nyid du dga' ba ni chags pa mi bya'o
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsad nams kyi tshogs 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu dad pas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du gal te gzhan ma rnams 'byor pa la bza' ba byin na de spang bar mi bya ste 'on kyang de nyid du dga' ba ni chags pa mi bya'o
translated: If, out of great faith, one gives food to others like the Blessed One in order to increase the accumulation of merit, one should not abandon that. However, one should not delight in that out of attachment.

original: // gzhan du na bsam gtan za ba nyid rim gyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // gzhan du na bsam gtan za ba nyid rim gyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the food of concentration itself will gradually deteriorate.

original: de bzhin du sngags ni mi 'jigs pa'i yi ge bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags ni mi 'jigs pa'i yi ge bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should recite the mantra of the syllable of fearlessness.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ste mdog dang dbyibs dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ste mdog dang dbyibs dang rlung dang rnam par shes pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The unimpaired limb is the nature of non-duality, free from color, shape, wind, and consciousness.

original: 'on kyang ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: However, one should recite in the nature of the neuter recitation.

original: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of yogī?

original: 'dod pa kun ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa kun ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma ste /
translated: All desires are the nature of those, the wisdom consort who is the essence of the Blessed Lady Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de dang lhan cig tu longs spyod pa ni bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu longs spyod pa ni bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: Enjoying together with her is the experience of great bliss.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: It shows that one is a yogī who enjoys all desires.

original: de ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa dang sgrub pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa dang sgrub pa rnams so //
translated: That is the extremely unelaborate conduct, the stage of vajra recitation, and the accomplishments.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The result of the elaborate conduct should be taught.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “body, speech, and mind,” and so on,🔽the yogī with elaboration,

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas gal te /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas gal te /
translated: if he recites the mantra,

original: tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa yongs su gyur pas bde bar gnas pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi brtan pa nyid gsal por thob na de'i byang chub ni chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob🔽pa ni rnyed par dka'o //🔽gal te rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'am /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa yongs su gyur pas bde bar gnas pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi brtan pa nyid gsal por thob na de'i byang chub ni chos 'byung gi mngon par byang chub thob pa ni rnyed par dka'o // gal te rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin brtan pa'am /
translated: When that is attained, his enlightenment is the attainment of the manifest enlightenment in the source of the Dharma.

original: gsal por ma rdzogs na de'i tshe dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / dam tshig nyams pas so //
analyzed: gsal por ma rdzogs na de'i tshe dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / dam tshig nyams pas so //
translated: If that very yogin does not complete the stable or clear meditative stabilization of the creation stage, then at that time, untimely death and the deterioration of the commitments will occur.

original: yang na bdud rtsi myong ba'i cho ga ma bsgoms pas dus ma yin par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na bdud rtsi myong ba'i cho ga ma bsgoms pas dus ma yin par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, because of not cultivating the rite of tasting the elixir, there will be untimely death.

original: 'jig rten 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result in this very world.

original: dmyal bar nges par bsreg par 'gyur //
analyzed: dmyal bar nges par bsreg par 'gyur //
translated: He will certainly be burned in hell.

original: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin spangs pas skye bo bzhin du dmyal bar 'gro'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin spangs pas skye bo bzhin du dmyal bar 'gro'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that, like a person who abandons meditative stabilization, he will go to hell.

original: de'i phyir yun ring @105b du rgyun ma chang par brten par byas na ting nge 'dzin ni brtan par 'gyur te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yun ring @105b du rgyun ma chang par brten par byas na ting nge 'dzin ni brtan par 'gyur te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one relies on it for a long time without interruption, samādhi becomes stable.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pas 'bras bu bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pas 'bras bu bsten par bya ste /
translated: One should rely on the result by means of unelaborate conduct.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can gyi rnal 'byor rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can gyi rnal 'byor rnams so //
translated: “Buddha” refers to the yogins who are of the family of the five tathāgatas.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: byang chub ni lung du bstan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni lung du bstan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma ste /
translated: “Enlightenment” refers to the prophetic consort.

original: de dang lhan cig sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The one who has that “hero” is the bodhisattva,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma dang ldan pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma dang ldan pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: indicating that he is endowed with the pledge seal.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams chos mchog mi g-yo ba bsnyengs pa yang zhes pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa rnams chos mchog mi g-yo ba bsnyengs pa yang zhes pa la /
translated: Such yogins “are not afraid of the immovable supreme Dharma.”

original: chos mi g-yo ba'i chos ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos mi g-yo ba'i chos ni chos nyid do //
translated: The “immovable Dharma” is reality.

original: mi g-yo ba ni g-yo ba mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni g-yo ba mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Immovable” means not moving, not changing.

original: chos kyang de yin la mi g-yo ba 'ang de yin te /
analyzed: chos kyang de yin la mi g-yo ba 'ang de yin te /
translated: It is the Dharma and it is immovable.

original: chos mi g-yo ba ste chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mi g-yo ba ste chos kyi dbyings kyi mngon par byang chub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the unshakable Dharma, the manifest enlightenment of the realm of phenomena.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: 'dod pa thams cad ni ral pa'i cod pan dang / shing la sogs pas byas pa'i gdong ba can dang / lag pa dang mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ni ral pa'i cod pan dang / shing la sogs pas byas pa'i gdong ba can dang / lag pa dang mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
translated: All desires are the topknot of matted hair, the face made of wood, etc., the hands, weapons, etc.

original: de bzhin du bsten pa ni shing thog la sogs pa za ba dang / nags tshal la slong mo slong ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsten pa ni shing thog la sogs pa za ba dang / nags tshal la slong mo slong ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the practice is eating fruit, etc., and begging in the forest.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid do //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid do //
translated: This is the creation stage.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i sbyong ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i sbyong ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The result of the extremely unelaborate training should be explained.

original: chags can ye shes 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: chags can ye shes 'dod pa yis //
translated: One who is passionate, desiring wisdom,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dod yon lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bsam gtan gyi bza' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod yon lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bsam gtan gyi bza' ba ste /
translated: The five objects of desire are the food of concentration, which is the nature of the five transcendent ones.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni spyod pa'o //🔽de bzhin du ye shes ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni spyod pa'o // de bzhin du ye shes ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma ste /
translated: The teaching of that is the practice.🔽Similarly, wisdom is the wisdom consort.

original: de 'dod pas na ye shes 'dod pa'o//
analyzed: de 'dod pas na ye shes 'dod pa'o//
translated: Desiring that, one is desirous of wisdom.

original: chags pa ni snying rje chen po ste de gang la yod pa de ni chags can no //
analyzed: chags pa ni snying rje chen po ste de gang la yod pa de ni chags can no //
translated: Attachment is great compassion, and one who has that is an “attached one.”

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas byang chub sems dpa' mnyes par bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas byang chub sems dpa' mnyes par bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is pleased by such a yogin, who has attained the stage of non-conceptuality.

original: de bzhin du chags par bya ba ni bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub nyid du bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du chags par bya ba ni bla na med pa'i mngon par byang chub nyid du bya ba ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o ;
translated: Similarly, one should be attached to the unsurpassed manifest enlightenment, which is the completion stage.

original: / da ni yul la longs spyod pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: / da ni yul la longs spyod pa'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, purity is to be explained from the point of view of enjoyment of the objects.

original: gzugs la rnam gsum shes byas nas //
analyzed: gzugs la rnam gsum shes byas nas //
translated: Having understood form to be of three kinds,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽phyi dang nang dang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs rnam gsum du zhes pa ni ro gcig par gyur pa yongs su brtags te lha ni @106a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / phyi dang nang dang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs rnam gsum du zhes pa ni ro gcig par gyur pa yongs su brtags te lha ni @106a * //
translated: and so on.

original: mig gi dbang po dang / de'i shes pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / de'i shes pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Form is of three kinds, external, internal, and both, which are of one taste, imagined, and the deity is to be offered to the eye faculty and its consciousness.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das sna tshogs pa shes pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das sna tshogs pa shes pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the Bhagavat, the knower of the varieties, is Vairocana, the nature of all things, both animate and inanimate.

original: mig dang gzugs dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa gang byung ba de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo me long lta bu'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa gang byung ba de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo me long lta bu'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the mirror-like intuition, the essence of Vairocana, which is the visual consciousness that arises from the eye and form.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol la sogs pas tha dad pa'i sgra rnam pa gsum du shes te //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol la sogs pas tha dad pa'i sgra rnam pa gsum du shes te //
translated: One should understand the three kinds of sound, external, etc.,

original: de las byung ba'i sna'i rnam par shes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo rin chen 'byung ldan bsgom par bya'o ;
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sna'i rnam par shes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo rin chen 'byung ldan bsgom par bya'o ;
translated: One should cultivate the universal equivalence intuition, the essence of Ratnasaṃbhava, which is the olfactory consciousness that arises from that.

original: / de bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyi dri rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rtog pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyi dri rna ba'i rnam par shes pas rtog pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the discriminating intuition, the essence of Amitābha, which is the auditory consciousness that arises from the three kinds of sound.

original: rim pa de nyid kyis rnam pa gsum gyi ro myang ba'i skabs su ro'i rnam par shes pa bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo don yod grub pa'i ngo bo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa de nyid kyis rnam pa gsum gyi ro myang ba'i skabs su ro'i rnam par shes pa bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo don yod grub pa'i ngo bo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the same order, in the context of the experience of the three aspects, one should meditate on the consciousness of the experience, which has the nature of the activity of accomplishing, as being Amoghasiddhi.

original: de nas rnam pa gsum gyi reg pa las 'byung ba lus kyi rnam par shes pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa gsum gyi reg pa las 'byung ba lus kyi rnam par shes pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the contact of the three aspects, one should meditate on the body consciousness that arises from that, which has the nature of the dharmadhātu, as Akṣobhya.

original: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The summary will now be explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams de dang de lta bu'i bsgom pa'i rim pas gal te rnal 'byor pa sems nges par sbyong zhing nye bar gtang na de'i tshe 'di nyid de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin ye shes lnga'i ngo
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams de dang de lta bu'i bsgom pa'i rim pas gal te rnal 'byor pa sems nges par sbyong zhing nye bar gtang na de'i tshe 'di nyid de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin ye shes lnga'i ngo
translated: If the yogin, by means of the process of meditation on the objects such as form in that way, trains the mind and is able to give it up, then at that time, this very thing is the secret of all the buddhas, the nature of all the buddhas, the essence of the five gnoses,

original: bo gsang ba ste bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la brten pa la mi brten pa snying po ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: bo gsang ba ste bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul la brten pa la mi brten pa snying po ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: the essence of the tathāgatas, which is not based on the mode of activity, and so on.

original: de rnams bsdus pa ni ye shes lnga'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de rnams bsdus pa ni ye shes lnga'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that the yogi/nī will attain the meditative stabilization that is the nature of the five exalted wisdoms by means of those.🔽The form and so forth

original: gzugs so // rnal 'byor ro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs so // rnal 'byor ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the yogas.

original: gzugs la sogs pa lnga pos lha ni ye shes sam dam tshig gi phyag rgya gcig pu de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par dag pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lnga pos lha ni ye shes sam dam tshig gi phyag rgya gcig pu de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par dag pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: With the five beginning with form, one should meditate on the deity, either the wisdom or the pledge seal, as the single entity that is the purity of the five exalted wisdoms or the five Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de la mdangs dang mdzes pa dang ldan pa de'i lus sra ba ste sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad bsam mo //
analyzed: de la mdangs dang mdzes pa dang ldan pa de'i lus sra ba ste sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad bsam mo //
translated: With respect to that, one should think that the body of that one endowed with radiance and beauty is the earth element, the nature of which is solidity, and is Vairochana.

original: de bzhin du ngang pa dang phug ron la sogs pa de dang 'dra ba de'i bde ba'i sgra ni rin chen dbal gyi rang bzhin nam mkha' rnam par dag pa dang / mtsho @106b skyes dang gla rtsi la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de'i lus dang padma'i dri ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngang pa dang phug ron la sogs pa de dang 'dra ba de'i bde ba'i sgra ni rin chen dbal gyi rang bzhin nam mkha' rnam par dag pa dang / mtsho @106b skyes dang gla rtsi la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de'i lus dang padma'i dri ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Similarly, one should think that the sound of pleasure of that one who is like a goose, a pigeon, and so forth is the space element, the nature of which is Ratnasambhava and is the purity of space, and that the smell of the body and lotus of that one who is like a lake-born [lotus], musk, and so forth is the water element, the nature of which is Amitābha.

original: me'i rnam par dag pa dang / de'i ma mchu'i ro myang ba ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: me'i rnam par dag pa dang / de'i ma mchu'i ro myang ba ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The purity of fire and the tasting of her lower lip is Amoghasiddhi’s nature.

original: rlung rnam par dag pa dang / de'i yan lag reg pa las 'jam pa'i reg pa chu'i khams rnam par dag pas mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung rnam par dag pa dang / de'i yan lag reg pa las 'jam pa'i reg pa chu'i khams rnam par dag pas mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o //
translated: The purity of wind and the smoothness of her limbs from the contact of her limbs should be contemplated as Akṣobhya’s nature, by the purity of the water element.

original: de ni phyag rgya gcig gi rim pas de kho na nyid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyag rgya gcig gi rim pas de kho na nyid la byed pa'o //
translated: This is the reality of the single seal stage.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de la ni ye shes ngang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dag las gang yang rung ba /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de la ni ye shes ngang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dag las gang yang rung ba /
translated: Or else, etc.

original: rigs kyi tshul du ni spyan la sogs pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi tshul du ni spyan la sogs pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: There, in the manner of the family, any of the gnosis pledge seals should be contemplated in the manner of the family, by the division of Locanā, etc., and Rūpavajrā, etc.

original: de la ni de'i nu ma'i sra ba ni spyan gyi ngo bo dang / de'i ma mchu'i ngo bo ni chu'i khams m'a ma k'i dang / de'i padma'i drod kyi rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang / de'i bskum pa dang brkyang pa dag ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma dang /
analyzed: de la ni de'i nu ma'i sra ba ni spyan gyi ngo bo dang / de'i ma mchu'i ngo bo ni chu'i khams m'a ma k'i dang / de'i padma'i drod kyi rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang / de'i bskum pa dang brkyang pa dag ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma dang /
translated: In that case, the hardness of her breast is Locanā, the essence of her lower lip is Māmakī, the nature of the heat of her lotus is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, her contraction and expansion are Tārā, the nature of the wind element,

original: de'i padma'i nang gi khong stong nam mkha'i rang bzhin te chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: de'i padma'i nang gi khong stong nam mkha'i rang bzhin te chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: and the cavity inside her lotus is the nature of space, the goddess of the realm of reality.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa de'i mdangs dang bde ba'i sgra dang kha dang padma'i dri dang ma mchu'i ro dang lus reg pa la sogs par shes par bya ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
