analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa de'i mdangs dang bde ba'i sgra dang kha dang padma'i dri dang ma mchu'i ro dang lus reg pa la sogs par shes par bya ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: One should understand that the radiance of Rūpavajrā, and so on, is her sound of bliss, the smell of her mouth and lotus, the taste of her lower lip, and the touch of her body, and so on.

original: yang na gzugs ni rnam pa gsum //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na gzugs ni rnam pa gsum //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Or, form is threefold, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga po rnam par spyod na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga po rnam par spyod na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
translated: When the five objects such as form are experienced, they are empty of the nature of one and many, arising by the power of conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa de yang sgra las byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang sgra las byung ngo //
translated: And that conceptual thought arises from sound.

original: sgra'i rgyu ni rtog pa dang rtog pa'i rgyu yang sgra yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rab tu grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra'i rgyu ni rtog pa dang rtog pa'i rgyu yang sgra yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rab tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: The cause of sound is conceptual thought, and the cause of conceptual thought is sound. Thus conceptual thought and sound are well known to be the essence of cause and effect.

original: de bas na sgra rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: de bas na sgra rnam par dpyad na /
translated: Therefore, when sound is analyzed,

original: a'a li dang k'a li las logs su med de a'a li dang k'a li de dag kyang bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi ngo bo 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang pa'i bdag nyid can gyis bcom ldan 'das yi ge gsum la ldan par 'gyur
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li las logs su med de a'a li dang k'a li de dag kyang bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi ngo bo 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang pa'i bdag nyid can gyis bcom ldan 'das yi ge gsum la ldan par 'gyur
translated: it does not exist apart from the vowels and consonants. Those vowels and consonants, which have the nature of female, male, and neuter, and the nature of engagement, abiding, and rising, are contained in the Blessed One's three syllables.

original: ro // des na gzugs la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ro // des na gzugs la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, form and so forth become the nature of the three syllables,

original: rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: and are taught to be threefold.

original: de rnams spyi bo la sogs par bsams la /
analyzed: de rnams spyi bo la sogs par bsams la /
translated: Having contemplated those at the crown of the head, etc.,

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha rnams te /🔽rnam par @107a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha rnams te / rnam par @107a * //
translated: one should offer the deities, Vairochana, etc.,🔽who are of the nature of the five Tathagatas,

original: snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam pa 'od gsal ba la dbul ba ni bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam pa 'od gsal ba la dbul ba ni bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: to the clear light of the form of Great Vajradhara, by the process of entry, etc.

original: de ni nges pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.🔽Therefore, one should train in the external, such as form, sound, taste, etc.,

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang sgra dang ro la sogs pa'i phyi rol pa la rtag tu sems ni rjes su mthun pa nyid du thob par sbyor ba ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis slob par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang sgra dang ro la sogs pa'i phyi rol pa la rtag tu sems ni rjes su mthun pa nyid du thob par sbyor ba ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis slob par bya'o //
translated: by the process of entry, etc., always applying the mind to attain conformity.🔽Thus, the secret of all the Buddhas, who are of the nature of Vairochana, etc.,

original: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags rnams kyi gsang ba ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngags rnams kyi gsang ba ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: is the three syllables.

original: snying po ni snying por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snying po ni snying por gyur pa'o //
translated: The essence is that which has become the essence.🔽The assembly is the gathering of the vowels and consonants.

original: 'dus pa ni a'a li dang k'a lis bsdus pa slob par bya'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni a'a li dang k'a lis bsdus pa slob par bya'o zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: One should train, this is the remainder of the sentence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ste yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kyis lha ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ste yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kyis lha ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the deity, by means of the three syllables, which are form, sound, etc., should attain the stage of clear light.

original: yang rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud kyi dbye bas le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i rim gyis rigs kyi tshul du rnam par bsgom pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i dbye bas yi ge gsum de bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud kyi dbye bas le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'i rim gyis rigs kyi tshul du rnam par bsgom pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i dbye bas yi ge gsum de bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, by means of the division of the Yoga Tantras, one should meditate on the three syllables, by way of the families, in the manner stated in the thirteenth chapter, and one should repeat the three syllables by way of the division of the repetitions of Vairochana, etc.

original: de ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the vajra repetition.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa shes pa la tha dad pa gzhan med do zhes rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa shes pa la tha dad pa gzhan med do zhes rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, there is no other difference in the consciousness of form, etc.

original: rnam gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas shes nas lha rnams ni thams cad stong pa nyid la phul ba ni 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas shes nas lha rnams ni thams cad stong pa nyid la phul ba ni 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having known the three aspects by way of the division of appearance, etc., one should enter into the offering of all deities into emptiness.

original: rigs pa 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa la rtag tu sems nges par sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sems par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa la rtag tu sems nges par sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sems par bya'o //
translated: By this reasoning, one should always fix the mind on form, etc. , thinking of the nature of form, etc.

original: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad ni ye shes gsum gyi gsang ba ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad ni ye shes gsum gyi gsang ba ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: This is the secret of the three wisdoms of all the Buddhas, which is clear light.

original: snying pho ni brtan pa dang / 'dus pa ni stong pa bcu drug bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid de thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying pho ni brtan pa dang / 'dus pa ni stong pa bcu drug bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid de thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The heart is the essence, and the gathering is the characteristic of the gathering of the sixteen emptinesses, which is the essence of all emptiness, which should be cultivated.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Form, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa gsum gyis so //
translated: Its nature is the three consciousnesses.

original: lha nyid du bsgom pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lha nyid du bsgom pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Cultivating the deity is cultivating the moon disc, etc.

original: yang na rigs kyi tshul ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba des ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu nye bar bsdu par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rigs kyi tshul ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba des ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu nye bar bsdu par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Or else, by that division of wisdom, method, ignorance, etc. , the mode of the family is the nature of the one hundred and sixty, which should be cultivated by gathering.

original: de ni sems rnam @107b par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam @107b par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the pure mind.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum sgyu ma'i ngo bo sku zhes pa ni 'od gsal pa las langs te gzhan yang lha rnams ni 'od gsal ba la dbul par bya ba ni bzhugs
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum sgyu ma'i ngo bo sku zhes pa ni 'od gsal pa las langs te gzhan yang lha rnams ni 'od gsal ba la dbul par bya ba ni bzhugs
translated: Or else, form and so on are the three aspects of the nature of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Apparition Body, the essence of illusion, the Body, which arises from clear light, and the gods are to be placed in clear light.

original: par bya'o // rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du /🔽ji ltar dang ba'i chu dag las //
analyzed: par bya'o // rab tu byed pa las kyang ji skad du / ji ltar dang ba'i chu dag las //
translated: And in the Prajfiiipiiramitii it is said:🔽Just as a fish suddenly leaps

original: nya ni myur du ldang bar 'gyur //🔽thams cad stong pa dang ba las //🔽sgyu 'phrul dra ba de bzhin 'byung //
analyzed: nya ni myur du ldang bar 'gyur // thams cad stong pa dang ba las // sgyu 'phrul dra ba de bzhin 'byung //
translated: from clear water,🔽so does the net of illusion arise

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: from the clarity of universal emptiness.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos bsgom pa ni rigs lnga'i dbye bas /
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos bsgom pa ni rigs lnga'i dbye bas /
translated: Then, the meditation on the nature of Vairocana and so on is by the division into five clans,

original: de nyid las cig car du ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las cig car du ldang bar bya'o //
translated: and one should arise simultaneously from that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, all the Buddhas are by the yoga of the perfection stage.

original: gsang ba ni blang par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni blang par bya'o //
translated: The secret is to be taken.

original: snying po ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: snying po ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The essence is that the yogis of the creation stage should practice.

original: 'dus pa ni skad cig mas byang chub ster ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dus pa ni skad cig mas byang chub ster ba'o ;
translated: The assembly is the bestowal of enlightenment by the instant.

original: / rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i sems nges par sbyor ba ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i sems nges par sbyor ba ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By this very reasoning, the form, sound, etc. of the nature of the body should be practiced as the definite application of the mind.

original: gang zhig gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa blta ba de rnams lha nyid du bsgom pa ni sgyu ma'i ngo bor dran par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa blta ba de rnams lha nyid du bsgom pa ni sgyu ma'i ngo bor dran par bya'o //
translated: Those who see form, sound, etc. should meditate on them as the deity, remembering them as the nature of illusion.

original: yang na rigs kyi tshul ni sgyu ma'i rigs kyi dbye ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rigs kyi tshul ni sgyu ma'i rigs kyi dbye ba ste /
translated: Or else, the principle of the family is the division of the family of illusion.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The twelve examples of illusion should be meditated upon.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Prajñāpāramitā🔽it is said:🔽The reflection in a mirror, a dream, an illusion, a bubble,

original: me long la ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mi 'phrul dra ba dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: me long la ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mi 'phrul dra ba dang 'dra ba //
translated: a mirage, a magical creation,

original: gang gis blta ba de gtso yin //
analyzed: gang gis blta ba de gtso yin //
translated: the one who sees is the chief.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

original: yang na gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma rnams te de dang lhan cig tu snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba rnam gsum ni chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa bar ba'i dbye bas shes nas lha rnams la ni de kho na nyid bzhi ba la dbul bar bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa 'od gsal ba la bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya ma dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya ma rnams te de dang lhan cig tu snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba rnam gsum ni chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa bar ba'i dbye bas shes nas lha rnams la ni de kho na nyid bzhi ba la dbul bar bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa 'od gsal ba la bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: Having understood the three kinds of bliss by the divisions of being free from attachment, being attached, and being in between, one should offer them to the deities in the four realities, and one should cause them to abide in the clear light of passion and so forth.

original: gang zhig 'od gsal ba de yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'od gsal ba de yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: And that clear light should be understood as having the nature of the five pristine awarenesses of Vairochana and so forth.

original: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //🔽zhes pa ni 'dod chags @108a * //
analyzed: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi // zhes pa ni 'dod chags @108a * //
translated: This is the secret of all the Buddhas,

original: la sogs pa'i gsang ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i gsang ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: the fourth,🔽the essence of the five pristine awarenesses,

original: snying po ni ye shes lnga ste de rnams 'dus pa ni /
analyzed: snying po ni ye shes lnga ste de rnams 'dus pa ni /
translated: the union of all of them.
